<Rating>4<//Rating><Text>By far the best pizza I've had in the city. Because it's always super noisy and crowded in there (the Western Addition location) we always order a pizza to go. While the deep dish is super tasty (and seems to be a favorite of others), I'm actually a fan of the thin crust. If you're looking for a wonderful cornmeal crust pizza for a reasonable price, I definitely recommend Little Star Pizza. If you don't like noise and crowds, I'd recommend phoning in a pick-up order. If crowds and noise adds to the overall dining experience for you, then eat at the restaurant.<//Text>< Pictures>

< text>
Long waits on the weekend, but overall, the pizza is pretty good.  It's not the same deep dish pizza you would get in say  Irvine, CA due to it's texture and fillings, etc, but it's a different kind of good.  It's really filling too.  I eat a lot but usually 3 slices will do me in.  They have a small, yet commendable micro brew selection.  I recommend the  Irvine, CA as it goes well with the pizza.</text>

< Review>
The restaurant is not properly managed, no napkins, table and floors not cleaned after customers.

Today, when I walked in the Woodbridge location, I noticed two workers behind counter were cleaning floors and counters, sweeping floors and wiping down counters. I kept watching to see if they would put on new clean gloves before making food for customers, they DID NOT, but proceeded to make food with contaminated gloves. We walked out without ordering anything.

Probably won‚Äôt be going back anytime soon.

We‚Äôve eaten there in the past and the pizzas are OK.</Review>

<Gmap_id>0x80dcdd09ebee3d75:0x76d2ff9546193140<//Gmap_id><Review>Very slow and inefficient assembly line.

My suggestions for improvement: They really need to have at least 4 people working during busy hours.  1 making the dough (some should be prepped ahead of time cause this is a bottleneck), 1 on ingredients,  1 taking pizzas out, cutting and adding the finishes and 1 on the register. The guy taking out pizza and working the register at the same time slows down the process a lot.

I come during the evening time after 7pm and it's always so slow even though they have more workers available in the back, they have only 3 people actually working.

BOTTOM LINE: Great pizzas but hindered by an inefficient assembly</Review><name>Vinny<//name></record>

<time>1565922805096<//time><Rating>3< /Rating><Review>Great lunch place and decent dinners too! Pizza press is a build your own pizza place themed on early 20th century printing companies (think newspapers). You start with the size you want they 'press' a blob of dough into a pizza crust,  then you select the type of sauce (marinara,  bechamel,  or white/garlic), next you pick your cheese and toppings.  After that the pizza bakes on a conveyor belt oven, you pick your final toppings/sauce and you're on your way.  They have soda & juice for the kiddos and beer for the adults, and lots of it, whole counter of beers on tap.
The one downside to this location is that it's kid heavy. All locations are popular with the stroller brigade,  but this one is also next to the highschool.  Totally worth it though.</Review><name>Patience Kleine< /name>< Gmap_id>
0x80dcdd09ebee3d75:0x76d2ff9546193140<//Gmap_id>
< pictures>
None</pictures>

<username>Josh Lewis< /username><rating>1< /rating><GmapID>0x80dcdd09ebee3d75:0x76d2ff9546193140</GmapID>< Text>
I've been twice now, the first time service was okay and food was mediocre but not awful.

The second time I went I asked for a couple different ingredients, and the woman behind the counter told me they were out. I shrugged and said okay, but while my pizza was baking another customer asked for the same ingredients, and another worker was walking out to clock out, overheard the customer, and offered to go back and chop some ingredients for the customer.

It was still almost three hours before they closed, the girl just told me no because she didn't feel like chopping some more onions/mushrooms for my pizza. That's the last time I'll go there.<//Text>

<UserId.>103335656603499654846</UserId.><username>Dennis Padia< /username>< date>
1550873367256<//date>
< rate>
3</rate>
< text>
We tried this place as we got promotional offer on facebook (Buy 1, Get 1). If you had tried Mod Pizza, Blaze or Pieology then this place doesn't have any wow factor. Here pizza is baked in a conveyor oven unlike in other place where they bake it in pizza oven. I felt a bit let down as it didn't baked my pizza properly. So ask them to bake it for longer if you want a well baked pizza (they will put your pizza back in conveyor). Also I felt the base of their pizza was bit thick, so don't expect a thin crust pizza if you are going for their "Publish you own pizza".< /text>

<username>Lauren Ramsey</username><date>1550000077033< /date><Rating>2< /Rating>< text>
Me and my husband ordered online since it takes forever to order in person (even when there's 2-3 people in front of you). Waited the half an hour and even hit Barnes & Noble before we showed up 5mins after it should have been ready. They hadn't even started the order! We sat around another 10-15 mins before they brought it out. Ordered at 6pm and they handed us the pizza at 7pm. My husband said he got an email saying they hadn't acknowledged our order after 5mins so to give them a call. Why, to remind them to do their job?? All the napkins were empty, there were no soda lids, the floor was a mess and it wasn't even that busy. The only reason I don't give them 1 star is because their pizza is good and they gave us a coupon for a free pizza. They need to get it together.< /text>

I went in today, after which time my fever shot up 3 degrees. My entire body is sore and it takes effort to stay awake, which I was doing so I could get my prescription. Online pharmacy hours say they're open until 8. They are not. I double-checked my physical prescription and there are no pharmacy hours listed on the sheet. I probably shouldn't have let them give me a flu shot while I already have a fever and infection. So here I am with a fever of 103.7 and I have to go back to work the day after tomorrow with two fewer doses of antibiotics than if they could have gotten my my prescription the same day.

My bill was $200 for a 10-min doctor visitand a flu shot. The doctor didn't even seem to have time for me in those few minutes as she kept answering her own questions instead of letting me answer. The doctor gave me a 30-day supply of Zoloft and now won't let me renew my subscription. Having your body and brain get used to an SSRI and then withdraw from it is really terrible and makes one anxious and suicidal. I hate this place so much.< /Review>

< Text>
The three men who came to trim my trees had arrived early and I was not home.  I would have appreciated a call notifying me they were going to be early so that I could have been there when they started.  Quite a bit had already been cut (a little too high still.)  However, they were immediately responsive, reread the order, and did not hesitate to efficiently trim back the tree to requested specs.  And all with a smile!  Truly, their customer comes first.
These men were incredibly skilled at getting my "PG&E Hack Job" sycamore looking not just "normal, but terrific again!  They were always safety conscious, worked quickly, and also expertly pruned 2 trees in the back.  And when they were done, there was ZERO debris left behind.  ZERO!!  That was amazing.  I had beautiful trees and a beautiful yard again.
Look no further -- Call Joe at Quality Tree and get the job done on time at a fair price by professionals.  What a great job!  I will not only recommend them to friends, I will definitely be using them again.<//Text>

< Text>
Great work, affordable, and reliable.  Staff come to appointments on time and  call the day before to confirm appointment. <rate>5< /rate>< username>
Mary Greathouse< /username>
< Pictures>
None<//Pictures>
< Text>
If I could of given more stars I would have!! I have talked with several other tree services in the area and Quality Tree Care has, by far, been the best. I contacted them on a Sunday evening (because that's when I was up researching) and received a text right away. Danny showed up the next day and quickly surveyed the tree I needed help with. He gave me a quote immediately & could do the work the next day. I was thrilled!! He even gave me a coupon discount I knew nothing about. BUT...what impressed me beyond belief was the voicemail I received after the job was completed. The fellows who were cutting down the tree found a nest with baby birds in it. They carefully removed the piece of the tree with the nest, placed that piece up on a stump and even took the time to create a roof type structure over the nest with some bark from the tree. My heart was sad that I'd removed the home of a family of birds but when I got home & saw how they had treated it with such respect & kindness, my heart warmed a bit. I covered the little house they created with some jasmine branches and happily watched mama bird return to her nest. Thank you so very much Quality Tree Care for your amazing service, to not just me & my old broken tree but for your compassion to it's feathered residents.< /Text>

< review>
Many thanks for assisting me with a gift certificate purchase for my nephew for his birthday! I'm out of town, and he absolutely LOVES the store. Being able to purchase from afar is a huge help.  After speaking with the mgt. team there at the store over the phone, I heartily agree that Angler's Arsenal is by far and away amongst the most helpful and knowledgeable in the business.
We're up in Washington state and it was great to "fish-speak" and share happenings between north and south. I look forward to my nephew showing me the store on my next visit to SD!
Kudos and cheers!</review>

<rating>5<//rating>< date>
1462555912341<//date>
<Response>None< /Response>< review>
Shopping at Angler's Arsenal is the best experience I ever had at a bait & fishing tackle shop and quite possibly one of the best customer service experiences I ever encountered at ANY business! John Jr. and Jon the father and son combo who run Angler's Arsenal and Western Plastics (the company name for their custom plastic lures) are stand-up guys! I came in to Angler's Arsenal this weekend after having a disappointing day at one of the local lakes. I came here in search of some professional fishing guidance and some tackle suggestions. What I received from Jon was on point:* Friendly and more than willing to help answer my questions.* No short answers nor quick 'Yes' responses I've encountered at many other tackle shops.* In depth description of their custom-made plastics (Western Plastics).* Suggestions on bait that is working and how to work them.* I learned that they sell individual plastics which means you can buy onesies and twosies of 4" straight tail worms, 6" curly tail worms, 9" fat worms, 3" craw daddies, 3" flukes, 5" flukes, small frogs, large frogs, etc. etc. ¬†in several color and pattern choices! (This is great because you no longer need to purchase full packs of plastic bait and you can 'sample' various items until you find what you like and what works best at your fishing hole!).I will absolutely be coming back to Angler's Arsenal for most, if not all of my fishing gear needs! Because of my incredible experience this weekend at the shop I will be telling all my friends about how great this place is and recommend they come see John and Jon to get great tackle, excellent service and fishing tips.<//review>

< review>
This B of A has the worst customer service. It is the closest bank to my home but if I have the option, I will always drive to another location. Dulce declined to help my newly adopted twin daughters because they were closing in 20 min. They had no one waiting for personal bankers so this is just not the customer service I expect from my financial institution. Drove across the street and the bank was also closing soon but actually got great customer service. So I will be moving my account from B of A as well.</review>

<date>1505659956368</date></record>
</dataset><record>
<Date>1467145845096</Date>< name>
Rodney S<//name>
<Gmap_id>0x80dd2ea7815c0247:0x2a465a172d025a2c<//Gmap_id><Review>Zetton on it!  Zetton on it!

Ramen Zetton, the popular Costa Mesa ramen shop, has a new branch nearby me in Cypress.  For their soft opening, Ramen Zetton has priced their ramen bowls from $5 - $7.  Being a ramen lover & not one to pass up a discount, I hurried down to Ramen Zetton, eagerly awaiting slurping up some piping hot ramen.

The traditional ramen condiments are well represented - chili oil, white pepper grinder, vinegar, red chili pepper & house made spicy miso chili paste.

The house made spicy miso chili paste has a definite kick to it.  Not for spice weaklings.

I went for their signature Sesame Miso Tantan ramen ($7, reg. price $8.50)-

The tantan ramen broth is thick, almost curry-like.  Adding the entire jar of spicy miso chili paste, the broth became almost akin to marinara.  Plus, a splash of vinegar, some chili pepper, a drizzling of chili oil, freshly ground white pepper & a splash or 2 of vinegar. The vinegar is what really kicked the flavor profile up a notch.   Hearty & rich, the sesame miso tantan consisted of a special blend of sesame & miso, chicken broth, green onion, ground pork & vegetable puree.  The ramen had a good bite to it.  My preference would've enjoyed them more al dente, but I was not disappointed with the wonderfully thick broth & juicy chunks of ground pork.  At $7, a delicious bowl that's a must get!

Not feeling soup today?  Ramen Zetton's simplistic menu also has various rice dishes & gyoza for your consideration.

Service was good.  I arrived a few minutes before opening.  The father of the owner of Ramen Zetton was running the place.  The cook called in sick & one from the Costa Mesa location was brought in to save the day.  My water was refilled on a couple occasions & I was even given containers of the spicy miso chili paste to take home, w/o asking.  Not a place for large groups, seating is minimal with a few tables, booths & bar seating.

Parking is in private lot.  Hard to spot from the street, Ramen Zetton is located behind Oodles of Noodles Pho Restaurant & adjacent to Poki Roll.

Hurry & get down to Zetton!  Ramen Zetton serves up soothing bowls of ramen that are priced cheaper than their competitors.  The sesame miso tantan ramen was a winner & I'm eagerly anticipating trying their other ramen offerings.  I can't procrastinate, though, as I want to take advantage of Ramen Zetton's soft opening pricing.  Hungry for soup? Check out Ramen Zetton!

Highly recommend!
NOMNOMNOMNOMNOMNOMNOM<//Review><pictures>None</pictures>< UserId.>
102918253898437847981<//UserId.>

< date>

<Rating>3< /Rating><Text>Former place for Cambinos and Teriyaki Monkey Wave rises Ramen Zetton. If you've been to this location, you would know how small this kitchen and seating is. I would say it seats about 24-30 people max.  Lots of parking in the lot, near by Icon (For you craft beer people)

As for the Ramen, prices are still discounted for Classic ($5), Old School ($5), Special Salt ($6), Special Soy ($6). Of course, we tried one of each.  The noodles for the $5 are thinner (Chuka-Soba), while the Ramen for the $6 are thicker. The broth for the Classic tasted packaged, the Old school Shoyu had a light soy (my favorite) and the Specials had this Vegetable broth which was a bit too much I thought.

Non of the broth tasted in depth, unlike those day long tonkotsu broths but for what you get, it's okay. The chicken that does come with the noodle tasted like shoyu braised with sugar and that was just okay too. Kitakata is nearby, personally I would go there instead.

Service here with one person is pretty awesome I have to say, even with a packed house.
Yep check in gets you free soda currently.  I will have to make another trip to try the other noodles.<//Text>< pics>
None<//pics>

<Text>The glam and reviews definitely tricked us on this one. The only thing that‚Äôs nice, updated and fancy is the entrance and check in section on the 1st floor. After that, once you hit the floor the rooms are on, you get a outdated motel vibe. Room, walls, floors are very outdated and basic, bed is horrible felt like mattress that was worked to the springs then given away.. Bathroom has a mix of both outdated and a little bit of updates but no space for amenities at all. To top it off the price you pay definitely doesn‚Äôt make you feel good about what you get.. I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs only high due to the airport convenience and so they can eventually renovate.. It has potential it definitely needs to be updated though. Not satisfied for the price I paid for. If it was more realistic and reasonable I would‚Äôve understood and just had to have taken that L.</Text>< Response>

<date>1618730449123<//date><text>The hotel is very nice! The staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean, and it was fairly quiet despite it's proximity to the airport. However, what made the experience less than excellent were two things:
1. Ordering food from the restaurant involved standing in a line for 15 minutes at the bar, because there were only one person taking the orders and another person making drinks (they were also going back and forth to the kitchen to grab orders). I was overwhelmed just watching them.
2. The restaurant menus in the rooms are out of date. So imagine you've settled on your order, and you're told that you must place your order at the bar because placing your order in advance (over the phone) for pick up is not an option. Then, you wait 15 minutes in line to place your order only to be told that your desired item is no longer on the menu and the room menus are out of date.  Finally, you only have a few minutes to try to find another item on the menu before the 10 people behind you become agitated because you're taking a lot of time with the only waitress in the entire restaurant. That entire system is a disaster.

I also noticed the front desk was understaffed. There's more than enough stations to remain socially distant.</text>< rate>

<username>Hotels.com reviewer</username>< Review>
Common areas are visibly dated: carpets are frayed, trim is scuffed, dinged, and bent. Rooms are comfortable and have efficient and quiet air-conditioning system with easy controls. The bed was nice and clean but a little too soft for my taste. Bathrooms was  clean and updated. I had a nice walk-in shower.</Review>

< Review>
Sheraton deleted or Google deleted my review. So I'll add it again.

Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Hotel
Hotel
PLACE DETAILS

Valerie Brown

18 hours ago
I never thought I would be giving the Sheraton a 1 star review. I have stayed at this hotel on Century for years. Whenever my family and I travel to LA this is the only hotel we love to stay at.

Our first trip in while since COVID, and we booked the Sheraton. The lady in the room next to us was screaming in the hallway frantically the first night saying someone was following her and she was crying and very distraught. We thought well, that's scary but it could happen to anyone, and at least security had come to talk to her. Later that night about midnight, she was screaming and yelling and laughing and being extremely loud. This was Thursday, Friday night same thing. I told my husband I wanted to move rooms, I'm a light sleeper and I was up all night again. Saturday morning, as we we were getting ready to leave for the morning, her and her room occupant start screaming and yelling and things are being thrown against our wall. There's tons of yelling she is screaming help, he's going to kill me, I hope you go to jail. I called the front desk immediately, and they said they'd send someone up. This screaming and yelling went on for over 45 minutes in to the hall way and back into the room, to the point we couldn't leave our room without having to get involved or into the middle of it. We called again and they said they never sent anyone the first time. She went running down the hall screaming bloody murder and he chased after her, finally security came but they were gone. They were physically fighting and destroying hotel property.

Finally when security came they banged down my door and accused me of being loud and disruptive and receiving complaints. I had to explain it was the next room over.

We were able to get a room change at that point, but to top all of this off, not one time did they bring us new towels, clean our rooms, or even knock to offer to clean our rooms. Were there 4 days, and not once an offer for fresh towels or taking out the trash or refilling our coffee. Further more, we needed an extra blanket which took over 3 hours to receive. I called it in at 7:30 to 8pm and didn't receive it until 11-11:30pm.  All very disappointing and frustrating and security could not have been more useless when there was a serious SERIOUS issue going on, that woman  could have been killed by her boyfriend or whoever that was and they didn't come, they didn't even try to help. Thats some serious liability they are taking on, especially for other hotel guests being put in danger. They just let this crazy scene unfold for over 45 minutes.

People were smoking weed in the halls and everywhere we turned we ran into issues. This hotel has gone down hill. We have always loved the convenience, amenities and top notch service we've received in years past.  I'm not sure if its because of COVID or bad management but this hotel is garbage.  We will not be staying here ever again.</Review>

CLEANLINESS:  the lobby is absolutely filthy and the lobby and hallways are filled with marijuana scent‚Äîvery unpleasant. The room was clean, but the toilet didn‚Äôt flush. <Review>Visited for the first time, the staff was friendly and the rooms weren't bad.

Cons: I arrived with my family late night and the smell of weed and cigar was strong right outside.
If I pay $100+ for a room, I would assume the parking would be included.
The parking right in front the hotel was $33. There aren't many parking right in front the hotel. I mean, its a BIG hotel. There is an overflow parking lot behind the hotel.
I'd think those parking spots are at least included with the rooms. Nope!
If you go in and out, it's just over $2. If you stay there over night and not go out, expect to pay around $18.
I've stayed at other places that are smaller and better. I'd picked those ones over this hotel</Review><Pictures>None</Pictures><resp>None<//resp><Gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</Gmap_id></record>

< review>
Never before, have I arrived at a hotel and felt so confused as to what to do. Due to COVID - valet parking was closed. There were cars parked on all sides of the hotel, behind the hotel and even in spots that were reserved. The traffic of cars coming in, made the entrance so clustered. We were told to park anywhere - but luckily someone came out of a spot and I was able to park. Once I got to the room, I went into the bathroom to take a shower, and the water pressure was very low. To make matters worse, I woke up the following morning to get something from my car, and there were 2 tow trucks outside. I asked someone what was happening, and he told me that they were towing cars who didn't pay for a parking permit. At no point during check-in did they tell us we had to pay for a permit to park!! So 1 hour before checking out, I had to pay $33 for a permit to prevent my car from being towed. I return upstairs to shower before leaving for the airport and there's no hot water - none! I will never stay at the Sheraton in LAS again. I was beyond disappointed with my experience in that hotel.< /review>

<user_id>105713892750266579644< /user_id><username>Layne<//username><time>1582606742767< /time><Rate>5</Rate><review>We stayed here on the last leg of our crazy LA Trip. We were instantly greeted by the doormen who assisted us in getting our things up to the room. The huge marble columns and glass front doors give this place an upscale, classy vibe. Once in the door we looked up to the tall ceilings and beautiful decor of the lobby. We were checked In and up to our room with in minutes. The elevators are easy to access. Must use key card at night to access guest rooms from elevator. Now beware to the room number as the signs are misleading and you will end up on the other side as we did. The room had an amazingly fresh clean smell when we opened the door. We had a king size bed with a couch as well. We had a pretty cool view of the city and was able to catch a few planes landing. The room was very clean and stocked with the necessities. Huge tv and coffee maker. But let's talk bathroom. Very contemporary decor but I love it. Stand up shower only with full glass doors. Super hot water and awesome shower head!! Bed was the most comfortable ever and made me sad to leave. My only negatives about here is that housekeeping is a bit intrusive as they entered our room several times both days, even when we had our sign up and told them we didnt need it. The other issue is that they charged us 12.00 for a bottle water when we only drank one at 6.00 a piece. The concierge was very helpful as were the front desk ladies. The gift shop is moderately priced and has quite a bit to look over. The restaurant is spectacular and I recommend the egg rolls!! Theres also a Starbucks inside which I only seen open once. They do have great baristas and great coffee. The pool was being renovated so we were offered acess to a hotel pool near by but we didn't use it. The hotel is right next to LAX in a great location. Busy busy place but if your traveling for leisure, business, or a weekend getaway, this is the place for sure.< /review>< Pictures>

<review>I have stayed here in many occasions when I visit LA especially for layovers through LAX.  Ive always felt that this property is of good value and quality.  A lot has changed from my last visit 6 years ago and not for the better.

I was supposed to stay in LA for 3 days but decided to leave after one night.  I should have listened to some of the reviews here.

The moment I walked in the lobby, I already sensed a different vibe.  The moment I walked in the elevators, I smelled smoke and weed combined with chemical neutralizers to mask the scent.  it was strong and horrible.  I should have checked out right away but I was so tired from my international flight that I decided to proceed to my room.  The room had a smell but not as strong as the elevators.   However when you go to the bathroom where the main vents are, you will strongly smell it.  I had to close my bathroom door all the time and not breathe when im in the bathroom to avoid this.  Anyone who is health conscious should take this property off your list.

I tried to venture out to get some food and there were just creepy, shady and questionable characters roaming around.  When I walked in the elevator a woman had a portable electric stove and a small appliance and she told me she is moving in for awhile.  Long story short, this property has taken in needy groups of people who may need housing during this pandemic.  I applaud them for doing so.  I am all for helping the needy especially in this time of need.  However, guests like me deserve full disclosure.  I asked them before I checked in if this is true and they vehemently denied it.  That is an outright lie.  I am not appalled at their charitable actions, I am vehemently against their total disregard for paying guests to know what experience they may have to go through during their stay.  Im sure some guests are ok with it but some may not.  My biggest problem is the smell of smoke and weed that I have to inhale even in my room.  This is unacceptable especially for a non smoking hotel.  Please dont tell me that you fine guests who smoke in your room when these smokers are the homeless people who will not be able to afford paying the room let alone the smoking fine.  If this property wants to be a homeless shelter that is wonderful, I might even send some contribution to help but you cannot be both.  It is not fair for regular paying guests.

the one star is for the service I received from the lady in the front desk and the cleaning staff who really provide wonderful service despite the environment they are in.

The shuttle takes forever btw, I had to wait almost 30 mins before it arrived.  They had to call it and ask whats going on.  If you need something and you dial 0 from the room, you will either not get a response unless you have the patience to wait a very long time.

I understand that we are in a different world.  However, we cannot use this as an excuse to provide poor quality and expect guests to pay the same price.  There should be a balance in all this.  Sadly, I don't think I will be back in this property again.< /review><pictures>None<//pictures><name>AlexisRF F<//name>< UserId.>
109703158461556225484</UserId.>

<time>1528844970888</time><rate>5</rate>< Text>
Excellent.  A must stay when in LA. The Sheraton Gateway at the LAX Century Blvd.-Strip has been completely re-done. Top designers. All brand new. Including sleep enhancing healthy beds.
Best place to be away from home and to get the first true  feeling  of being a  Hollywood star. For every taste is something.  Quiet reading in a generously spread out lobby with comfortable seating, couches and tables everywhere.
Rooftop...private club....panorama view.
Top restaurant, top food at affordable prices.
Huge modern lobby bar: Under a super high ceiling held in light colors you'll run into people from all over the world and locals alike from all walks of life.  Relaxing at a beautiful quiet pool outside looking at the ever blue sky in Southern California lined with majestic  palm trees next to the stars in heaven... and much more.
Last but not least a dynamite staff that pampers you rounds the picture to a perfect circle.
PS: Better pictures are coming soon. What would you like to see?</Text>

I also felt that no one had intentions to listen or appreciate the new surfaced facts, answers from staff  were inconsistent too, one girl named Jennifer told she doesn't want to get fired by cancelling my reservation, another girl told me that as you have reached out to GM, which I did based on advise from the first girl, she won't cancel my reservation and have GM decide. steve benham</Name>
< Text>
what a place. i found the Sheraton Hotel amazing. really nice and helpful staff. as we pulled up outside it was an instant nice feeling. the lobby looks very impresive this was a patern that followed through out the entire building. very nice bar with lots of indoor seating and a lovely garden with a pool. hot tub and more seating. even private little tent style areas with seating. toilets never far. starbucks on ground floor as you walk in. sadly this closes quite early think it closed at 6pm. but tea and coffee also available at the bar. lots and lots of rooms. our last night there was a private wedding party on in the function room. the room itself upstairs was quite awesome. very nicely decorated with two queen beds. sofa. tv. fridge. safe. toilet and bathroom. extremely comfy bed. had two great nights of sleep. a very stylish modern catered for all hotel in a super location close to LAX. we went for a walk around the area but not alot. just many different hotels and a mc donalds a couple of blocks away. couldnt fault this hotel at all. it was one of the nicest hotels i have ever stayed in. maybe im not high enough up the ladder of life yet but i felt like a million dollars here.
please like this review if its been helpful
thank you< /Text>

<date>1583366400000</date><rate>None< /rate><text>I've stayed at a lot of airport hotels (3 on this one business trip alone) and this definitely feels like an airport hotel. Even though it's a Sheraton, don't expect anything super fancy. You're getting a good, clean room with good service, but you're not getting fancy bells and whistles. You can also tell this hotel is a bit dated if you care about that sort of thing. 

Pros: (1) Close to the airport (2) Free shuttle will have you there in <5 min and runs frequently (3) King room was very large (4) Lots of outlets in the room (5) (Mostly) Friendly staff (see below) (6) Gym is large - lots of equipment options and also provides mats & foam rollers 

Cons: (1) Lobby is kind of small - don't expect a quiet place to work if you need to as everyone is hanging out in the lobby (2) Elevators are SUPER SLOW - I think only 2 out of the 5 were working so lines would be 12-15 deep waiting for elevator (3) When this was brought to an employee's attention, there was no attempt to remedy the situation - employee was very rude (rest of staff was very attentive) (4) Bar dining area service is slow - I gave up trying to dine here</text>< Pictures>

< Review>
Came to town on personal business. Upgraded to executive suite which had a nice view of the pool and space to relax on a grey velvet like couch. Updated room and bathroom with modern design. Water a bit sulfury. But cannot be more pleased about the exceptional service - missing toiletries? Guest services handled it. They even have a robot butler! Concierge Lounge had a lovely breakfast spread with yogurts, eggs, cereal, fruits, pastries and oatmeal. Not keto friendly but appreciated. Evening spread was enormous- stunning veggie platter, hot dishes- steak fajitas and chicken enchiladas, sandwiches, cheeses. Coffees, waters, and sodas all day with some pretzel type snacks. I loved the spaces in the lounge and tv nooks. Great spot to get work done and watch planes. Gym and pool area also splendid. Lots of cardio, weights, and circuit. A dip in the pool - heated- was well deserved. Cabanas make you feel far and away from your average airport hotel. Luggage scales in the lobby also a nice perk to ease the mind of overpackers. Shuttle service impeccable. 5 minute from hotel to southwest. Coming in - with traffic less than 15 from baggage claim. Outstanding and dependable service. 20-40 minutes from Westwood/ westside  depending on traffic. Making this my LAX hotel every time.</Review>

< Review>
We were scheduled to sail on the Royal Princess on 3/7/20.  The cruise was cancelled.  Sheraton LAX was one of the hotel choices "non-Princess travel booked" passengers could try and get a room at.  We arrived at the hotel hungry, and tired (we had been at the pier for 9 hours awaiting our cruise). We called ahead for our room.  Arrived and check-in was a breeze.  The room was beautiful. The bed was comfortable (blessed rest).

The only reason for 4 stars is the restaurant at the hotel was meh... expensive as all get out. Mediocre food - it was cold when it got to the table.  Two of three meals served.  Had to chase down the third meal.  Couldn't get a glass of water to save your life!  Had to beg to get the bill.<//Review>

< text>
From check in to check out my experience was one of the best I've experienced so far, even comparing my all-inclusive experiences. Oscar and the entire front desk was prepared and ready to handle me along with 300 of my fellow associates that all checked in between that Monday and Tuesday and they did it with no conflict or confusion. I used to manage hotels and I must say the culture and environment the staff shared made my experience very delightful. I was checked in to a room with a tub but realized with my broken leg that I could risk hurting myself in a shower so immediately they found me a room with a tub with no resentment or hesitation. Usually when you ask to change rooms they get made and give your a horrible room just for inconveniencing them. But they didnt, even though I ask to speak with Oscar they manger didnt hesitate to say no problem I'll help you. she got me in a new room and even came up to help me with my bags to my new room. I thank that showed true leadership quality. She knew Oscar was busy with checking people in and she stepped in to show support so that they could continue to work effectively. < review>
My stay at this hotel was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had.  The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful from the valet attendants to the front desk personnel to housekeeping.  The hotel is posh, modern and clean. It is a lively hotel with friendly people and fun activities. I had dinner at the bar on the first night and the food was excellent.   The Club Lounge was an added bonus that enhances the experience of the stay.  If you are visiting LA, stay at this hotel.  I would recommend avoiding staying in the downtown area.  I initially booked a room at an expensive downtown hotel and changed to this hotel within 30 minutes of  checking in there (because I was so disappointed and disgusted with the original hotel).  The change in hotels was by far the best decision of my trip.  This hotel was twice the space for half the price and with staff who were amazingly friendly and helpful.   Stay here!</review>

<pictures>None< /pictures><UserId.>104295915969539285509</UserId.><rate>1<//rate>< text>
Extremely dissatisfied with my stay here at the Sheraton Gateway.

This hotel was basically like an upgraded version of motel 8. Perhaps I am spoiled with the amenities and hospitality found in Asian hotels, but there wasn't any toothbrushes, slippers or robes in the rooms. The hotel staff were not very welcoming or helpful. I asked multiple staff for recommendations on where to eat late night, initially they gave me a blank stare and then suggested restaurants that were already closed. No one offered to help bring my luggage to my room. The hotel smelled like marijuana around nearly every corner and in the halls on my floor. It almost seemed as though the hotel had been renting rooms to the homeless community of LA.

There was even a group of people filming a rap video in the entrance of the hotel (no social distancing or mask requirements).

With all of the covid-19 buzz going around, I expected a hotel with the reputation of Sheraton to have people sanitizing the elevator and door handles. I didn‚Äôt see anyone cleaning anything except for the carpet that laid on the ground in front of the hotel entrance.

For $170 a night I would NOT stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone.<//text>

Great hotel with friendly staff. Our flight was canceled so the airline booked a two night stay at this hotel with vouchers for food until we could could get a flight out of LA. The airline created some issues with the vouchers for the two night stay but the hotel staff worked with us to resolve the situation. They accepted a PDF from the airline assuring payment. The food was fantastic as was the room. The service in the Bar area was a bit slow which is the only reason I gave service 4 stars. The location is very close to the airport which really helped. Shuttles to and from the airport run constantly. Overall a very pleasant experience. Thank you so much.</review>

< review>
This is a nice hotel, very conveniently located right near LAX, and with a good airport shuttle service.  After I checked out, an erroneous charge ($8.49) was sneakily added to my credit card, and I wasn't notified.  I am in the process of trying to resolve this.  You can't reply to the e-mail address that the copy of the bill comes from (it is apparently bogus and not an e-mail address); since it was 10 days the Front Desk couldn't help; and I have to contact Accounting to get it reversed.  This system is poorly designed from the guest's perspective.  It is time consuming and inconvenient, when the hotel has made a mistake, and needs to be re-thought.</review>

<Date>1572825600000< /Date><Rate>None</Rate>< review>
It was only one night but the service and attention to detail was much appreciated. We also loved having a Starbucks inside the hotel which we conveniently bought before catching our shuttle to the airport. The only issue we had was the shuttle bus driver was a little dismissive of us and he ended up passing our terminal. When we told him, he just dropped us off at another terminal and told us to walk. It was about 3/4 mile walk...NOT at all what you want to do right before a cross country flight with a bunch of luggage. Thank God we were early. But other than that, we enjoyed our stay.</review>

<time>1550534400000<//time><Rating>None< /Rating><review>Outstanding hotel with fabulous food options available onsite.  This hotel has the usual, wonderful 4 star amenities, fitness center, pool, heavenly bedding, and comfortable rooms with comfortable seating, TVs, etc, depending on which type of room you choose.  The lobby is nice with plenty of elevators available so you don't have to wait long, and the restaurant and lounge options available onsite are fantastic.  The room service is pretty fast, all things considered and the food arrives hot, fresh, and service is professional, friendly, and with the right touch of hospitality.  This Sheraton receives my "Good" rating due to the self-parking experience which is quite a large city block away and you need to get a ticket from the front desk every 24 hours.  Also, I had one unfriendly housekeeping encounter.  All things considered, we interacted with maybe 10 or 12 employees whom we felt bent over backward to make sure we had absolutely everything and anything we needed,...JUST the way we needed or wanted it.  What a great experience.  If you'd like it to be "perfect", I'd recommend valet parking.< /review><Pictures>None</Pictures><Response>None<//Response>< gmap_id>

< review>
I stayed three nights at the Sheraton Gateway (LAX) in October for a conference.  The room was wonderfully comfortable with a view of the airports departing from LAX.  I thought at first it was going to be very noisy, but it was not that bad and a great view at night with all of the lights on.  The room was exceptionally clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  We had catered meals and snacks for the conference and the food was good, especially the coffee.  I would really like to commend the room cleaning staff and the staff that tended to us for the coffee/tea service and the catered meals.  These staff members were exceptional and assisted with each request or need quickly, with kindness, which I appreciated.  I would definitely stay here again.</review>

1583384584954< /Date>
<Rate>4</Rate>< review>
Stayed 3 nights for a conference. Room great and bed comfy. Only problem in room was the safe wouldn't lock. Housekeeping service rate and room super clean. Starbucks a big PLUS! A little disappointed with the guest services desk. My Roomate was from UK and needed help with finding train schedule LA to San Diego. I took her to the desk and she was told she could look it up on line. I was really disappointed to see 2 guys standing at guest services (not the check in desk) and not assist an international guest by going online and helping the guest. If they couldn't do it they should find someone who can. Parking cost too high. The restaurant food I'd say was fair. I ordered a flatbread w/meat & veggies and the edges were burned and the taste was unimpressive- very disappointing.  I brought hate boiled eggs for one meal/day and went to restaurant for salt and pepper. Shakers were gathered on a shelf near the bar and I reached for salt and pepper to sit down at the table and eat. The waiter kind of jumped at me and wanted to know where I was going with the shaker. Other than that- the hotel had a great overall vibe for being so close to the airport. I was overall very comfortable and would definitely come back.</review>

<Review>The hotel no longer seems to want to attract Marriott elites. This used to be a good option for Marriott/SPG elites who were flying out of LAX. However, they recently downgraded service in the club lounge so that it is a bare bones breakfast in the morning and very limited appetizers in the evening. 
The rooms are adequate, if dated. Service at front desk can be a bit slow if you arrive at the wrong time. Cleanliness is okay ‚Äî we found a pair of eyeglasses in our room from someone who had previously stayed there. (The front desk didn‚Äôt seem surprised by this when we returned them.) The housekeeper stopped by our room during our children‚Äôs nap to request that we leave at 3 pm rather than 4 pm since 4 pm was when her shift ended (which seems strange when Bonvoy guarantees a 4 pm checkout for platinum and above). 

Bottom line: we‚Äôd recommend this place if there are no other hotels in the area with availability, but there are better options for frequent travelers.< /Review>< pics>

<UserId.>None<//UserId.><user_name>MaryJimenez< /user_name><date>1539907200000<//date><rating>None<//rating><Review>Super enjoyed my recent stay at the Sheraton Gateway LAX for 2 nights. The check-in process was easy and we were given early check-in which always starts your stay off right! The room was beautiful and so clean.  The bar downstairs is a bustling metropolis morning, noon, or night! As energetic as this was, it was also hard to actually use the "business center" because it was so loud and located right smack dab in the bar area. I would love for the business center to be located away from the bar and restaurant area, as well as to have a door to provide privacy. I couldn't find a quiet place anywhere to make a personal phone call.
But what I LOVED THE MOST was the workout center/gym. I went both days I was there - once in the evening and once at 4:30 am. Both times the room was filled with amazing machines, ellitipticals, bicycles, treadmills and more. Every single machine was clean and ready to go, along with bottles of water, hand towels, music, and a TV. The room has a lovely view onto the pool area. Any time I went I felt so safe and secure as there are monitoring cameras and a key scan at the door. Truly this workout stay made a great stay even better!<//Review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< Response>

< Pictures>

<Text>This is a decent hotel for a fairly economical price (for the area). It's right next to LAX with a shuttle to the airport. Parking is an absurd amount though, so since we just stayed one night and didn't need to come and go we parked at the airport's Park N Fly for less than half the cost of hotel parking. We're not afraid of walking so just hoofed it the few blocks from there to the hotel. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The pool area wasn't great. The pool was heated, but barely, and there's one small hot tub with a max capacity of 4 people for an enormous hotel. I didn't have any interactions with reception, shuttle drivers, bartenders or housekeeping, so I can't speak to the staff, but being that I'm low maintenance and just needed a nice bed to sleep in near the airport this Sheraton did the trick.< /Text>< gmap_id>

<Rating>3<//Rating>< review>
I stayed at the Gateway for a conference this past week. Property was great, and a great location if you need to be by LAX.

The reason for the 3 stars: I waited for the free shuttle at Terminal 7 for 45 minutes - it is labeled "Joe's Parking Sheraton Gateway." The bus passed the pick-up spot 3 times; however, remained in the left lane (away from passenger pick-up) and did not stop or even slow down despite my waving it down. I called the hotel and they offered little support saying "they will try and call the driver." After paying for a Lyft and arriving at the hotel over an hour later, the front desk staff were unapologetic despite my frantically having to prep for a presentation in several minutes due to their delay.<//review>

<UserId.>101063874006270477035<//UserId.><user_name>Phil Walker<//user_name><Time>1582620652680</Time>< rate>
1<//rate>
<Text>Don't think when you say what time you will arrive that your room will be ready at that time !!!!
The above is the one main vital takeaway which had a huge impact on me on an otherwise great trip.  On booking here I was asked to say what time I would arrive.  I said I would be there at 7am.
Now considering the fee was over 1000 nz dollars for 3 nights I had I felt a totally reasonable expectation that I would gain access to my room at that exact time.
I arrived there from New Zealand after a 12 hour flight at 7am to be told I could not access my room until 3pm.  I said how I had made it clear I would be there at 7am but it was said that although you could say when you arrived it gave no guarantee.  As far as I'm concerned this should have been made clear for a hotel charging this much per night.
What annoyed me thereafter was that I accidentally drifted to sleep in reception and was told to wake up (fair enough).  I then saw someone asleep around the pool.  I felt that surely if I relax around the pool in my shorts and t shirt that going to sleep would be fine.  I was again told to wake up as someone next to me was as this was apparently 'a security issue'.  I felt given the situation this should have been okay.
The room was a nice room and a nice bed.  There was a little soap to shower with and a tiny shampoo and tiny conditioner.
The place seemed to have an ethos that rather than being anything special that you were paying for a privilege to be there.
The breakfast in the morning was nice but I couldn't help but wonder why on earth that wasn't included in the extortionate price.  An extra 30 dollars each morning.
I'm a vegan person and there wasn't any non dairy milk out so you ask for it and its then given in a glass.
The bar had one vegan option where I had a couple of burgers.  I feel the breakfast should have had some vegan protein sources, there were none.
Similarly I found it poor that outside the event I was at (virtual coach) taking place inside the hotel that the coffee outside did not offer any non dairy milk.
If I'd knew I could not get in my room when I arrived and the way the hotel was overall I would not have stayed there.  There are plenty of guest houses nearby I couldve stayed in for a 3rd of the price or less and just come over to my event.  Atleast I could have booked the night before and had a good nights sleep.
If you do want to go here at the very least don't assume your room will be ready when you arrive.  It had a huge impact on my energy levels.
Seeing 1076 nz dollars come out of my account today purely for the 3 nights stay makes me wonder where on earth that went to. A nice room and a nice bed.</Text><Pictures>None<//Pictures><resp>{'time': 1582730541734, 'text': 'Phil, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We do our best to honor an early check-in when available, but unfortunately, we could not do so on this occasion. We regret your visit was not as relaxing as it should have been. Thank you for the feedback, we hope to welcome you back for an improved experience.'}<//resp><Gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</Gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

< text>
My husband and I stayed here for a 14 hour layover and it was great. The shuttle was easy to locate, it got us to the hotel in under 10 minutes, and check-in was a breeze even though we arrived at an odd time. Clean and spacious rooms perfect for getting a good night's sleep right before jumping on another flight. Food at restaurants inside was a little pricey for what you get but there are some other place to eat near the hotel. Overall perfect for a quick relaxing stay.< /text>

< user_id>
None<//user_id>
< resp>
None< /resp>
< Review>
From the moment we arrived,  the valet staff were quick to assist us even though they were obviously busy. Even then,  they didn't rush us or make us feel unwelcome. On the contrary, they were friendly & helpful. Check in was also quick & easy. The staff here were also friendly & helpful. They have about six elevators so the wait there was never long. When we got up to our room we were expecting to find the bed took up most of the room. This wasn't the case. It was quite spacious, with plenty of room for a couch and a desk without walking sideways past anything. It was also clean and odorless. I've found most hotel rooms have an odor, as if trying to mask some kind of a smell. So, it was a nice surprise to find this room didn't smell and that added to the clean feeling. The restroom was one of the smallest I've ever seen, but it was modern and clean, and really that's all I ask for. We also had a few drinks at the bar, where again the staff was quick, and friendly. I'd like to point out, the hotel is "across the street" from LAX and I was not able to hear the airplanes from my room as I have in other hotels. I was quite surprised with that. Our overall experience was great. We'd definitely stay again.</Review>

I would say that a bit of the outdoor area is starting to look rundown, other than that a well put together hotel, and very nice rooms.  Be cautious though, the hotel is very close to the airport so you probably will hear the planes while trying to sleep. < text>
My allergies were not taken seriously. I stayed here for a 3-day event and the first meal they gave me had me recovering in my hotel room for 1&1/2 days (from a swollen face, hives, and major fatigue).

The last day of the event, I had to send my food back 2x because it looked like they seasoned it (or it was cross-contamination). Either way, it's not safe for people with allergies.

Additionally, if you like a quiet room and privacy... I can assure you that you'll be disappointed by the paper thin doors that connect the rooms.

Given I was in my room for whole day (allergies!) I heard multiple conversations from the neighbouring rooms... I had to turn on music/TV to drown out the noise.</text>

I returned to this hotel for 7 nights, based on the reasons I stated in my previous review. This time I was upgraded to an Executive Suite on the club floor, next to the elevators.

Note - the Executive ‚ÄúSuite‚Äù is not an actual separate-bedroom suite, but is a larger suite with an extended seating area for hosting perhaps 5-10 people in your room‚Ä¶ as they stare at your bed.

Proximity to the elevator wasn‚Äôt an issue, I didn‚Äôt hear any noise, but this time I was facing the end of the north LAX runway, and did hear the planes a lot more. Primarily because the runway ends before the hotel, so jets spooling up their engines are directing the backwash/sound towards the hotel windows. Honestly, it didn‚Äôt bother me too much.

Hotel has undergone some renovations, and staying longer this time I took more advantage of the pool and the gym, appreciating those facilities. The gym now features one of those ‚Äúvibrating‚Äù machines, but I couldn‚Äôt make heads or tails of how to use it.

Lounge continued to be excellent for breakfast and evening snacks, although every morning I took advantage of the Starbucks in the lobby before heading to the office.

I took more advantage of room service for working evenings as well, and the menu is the same from every Sheraton, with it‚Äôs healthy choices options. Food was always delivered quickly and as ordered, and certainly delicious! Even ordering pizza twice was simple, although I had to visit the lobby to pick it up as the club level is only accessible by keycard.<//text>

<Text>I had to be in the LAX vicinity for a few nights and I decided to spread my stays between the Westin LAX and the Sheraton Gateway. Before visiting either hotel, I had a preconceived notion that the Westin would be better, but after having now stayed at both I can attest that the Sheraton Gateway is by FAR the better option.

Check-in:
Prompt and courteous. There was a dedicated line for Marriott/SPG Elite members. As a Marriott Platinum Elite, I was upgraded to an Execute Suite and had lounge access.

Room:
The Executive Suite I stayed in was large, modern, and practically laid out. There were two TVs, a dining table, and sofa. Enough connectivity and USB outlets for me to do my work. My only complaint was how there wasn't enough insulting my room and the connecting room next door; I could hear a phone conversation from the person next door word-for-word. Part of this problem, I imagine, could be alleviated by the hotel installing door sweeps.

Club lounge:
Among the various Sheraton Clubs and executive lounges I've visited in North America, the Sheraton Gateway ranks among the best. The lounge was huge, with plenty of varying types of seating and more private areas to venture off to. During the day, the lounge was well stocked with beverages and fruit and snacks (chips, nut mix, etc.)

The highlight however was evening¬†hors d'oeuvres - the hotel doesn't hold back in offering a more than decent number of hot and cold options. One night they had salmon penne pasta and finger foods, while another night (which happened to be Thanksgiving!) they did the holiday justice by laying out sliced turkey and stuffing.

I also have to mention the lounge attendants, who were extremely professional, friendly, and attentive.

Breakfast/Brasserie restaurant:
I had the breakfast buffet at the hotel's Brasserie restaurant. I would give it a solid 9/10. There was a good amount of options (the usual eggs, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, etc.) as well as options like congee and potstickers.

Gym/Pool:
I used the gym and had a chance to look at the pool area. The gym was large and was well equipped with several cardio and weight machines. The pool area was clean and had free cabanas that you could rest on. This gave things a nice "Hollywood" feel - almost like you were staying in a downtown LA hotel.</Text>< time>
1543795200000< /time>
</record>
</dataset><record>

< Rate>

<Text>I decided to book this hotel as it was hosting a training I was scheduled to attend. The experience with the booking should've indicated that this would not be a pleasant stay. I booked through the hotel website and immediately found a better rate on another site. I filed a Best Rate claim through the hotel and had to battle to get it approved. Every staff member I encountered seemed to be in a rush and unable to attend to customer needs. As a result, 3 out of 3 meals I ordered in the restaurant were either incorrect or undercooked. One of the meals took over 45 minutes to come out and was undercooked. Not to mention that the hotel was totally unprepared to accommodate dietary restrictions. Our conference room was freezing everyday and could not be adjusted for comfort level beyond turning it off or on. The wifi situation was a frustration. There were 3 different connections: the rooms, the conference rooms and the lobby. And they often didn't stay connected. I contacted front desk to request something from housekeeping and as I was speaking, the woman hung up on me. Lastly, the floor I was on was quite noisy and I got the joy of listening to my neighbor's verbatim conversations through the wall. When I totaled up what I spent on this trip just on Starwood alone (hotel, parking, food, etc.) the value was just not there. I wish I would've stayed elsewhere and taken a taxi to the training. Along with other training attendees I have contacted the training provider requesting they find another location that is more customer friendly and cost effective. I can neither recommend this hotel nor say I would stay again.<//Text><Pics>None</Pics><resp>None< /resp><Gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</Gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

Had quite a pleasant stay at this Sheraton location! The room was perfect for my friend and myself. Got to enjoy the pool and hot tub, and then came in for a bite to eat at the bar. There's a nice nightlife atmosphere and we ran into a couple of celebrities which was pretty cool. Parking is $40 a night. < review>
Hotel is conveniently located near LAX.  The free shuttle is a great convenience.  The on-site restaurant is also a plus.  The food is excellent.  Meeting rooms are conveniently located on-site as well.  Swimming pool is a plus but, we didn't have time to try it out.  Elevators are always quick.  The robot that brings stuff to your room (things that you might have forgotten, like a toothbrush, etc..) is interesting.  I'd stay at this hotel again if I were to travel to Los Angeles on business again.<//review>

< text>
I made my reservation to spend the night before picking up my son from LAX early in the morning. Little did I know two months ago that I would have experienced two weeks of evacuation from the Thomas Fire before my trip down to LA. I was already nervous when I arrived after driving in LA traffic and when I got to the reception desk realized I had lost my credit card most likely at The Grove. They held on to my bags and directed me to my bank only 6 minutes away. It took an hour but I returned with my new card and checked it. They gave me a drink ticket for the bar. After taking my things to the room I planned to go have a well deserved drink. The room was such a surprise, very large, spotless, no awful cleaning supplies smell, and well appointed. The bar is lovely and the kind bartender made me the best martini! I can't get over how great the food is too. Had a wonderful night's sleep and they gave me a free breakfast coupon. The buffet has everything you'd want at a buffet. My son arrived on the Shuttle and off we went North. I would never stay anywhere else when at LAX! FYI I had just stayed at one of the Big Four on Nob Hill in SF and this was a better hotel!< /text>

The hotel is great. Super nice, clean, quiet, decent club room. However the restaurant was pretty bad. Food was mediocre, not even close to what they were charging for it. The service was abysmal, there was about a 1:1 ratio of guests to staff (I went at a slow time) and everything took forever. When I asked for the check, it took them over 20 minutes to complete that simple task. I'd stay here again, but avoid the restaurant.< /Text>

< text>
I requested a toothbrush set because in the lobby their is an advertisement that the "hotel robot" will bring anything to your door of simple toiletries. The instruction is to call the front desk and they will arrange. I called and they told me I could come down to the lobby if I wanted anything, I mentioned the robot and they said they were very busy... So why do you advertise this, and don't give an explanation because you are busy?? Really inattentive staff and maybe because they had a conference, but you can 't make excuses in any case. If you need more staff, hire them. There was a conference but does that mean we should expect bad service every time there is a conference there? I would not recommend this Sheraton to any business traveler. I was also not informed by the bell staff that there was a self park option as they had the hotel entrance set up for valet parking only... I found out from another guest. I also requested the hotel to refund me the valet fee but that isn't resolved yet. Other than this the hotel was good.<//text>

<Review>After reading some of the other reviews here, I was very nervous about staying at this property and would have cancelled if I had still been within the time period to cancel without penalty. Am I glad I didn‚Äôt!! Check-in was very efficient and easy. Parking valet attendants were friendly. The room was well appointed with what appeared to be new furnishings. When I called room service, I was greeted by name. Our food was hot and prepared correctly. We were not bothered by any noise in the hallways or adjacent rooms. When we left for the airport, there were two shuttles waiting; the drive to the airport was accomplished in under 10 minutes. All in all, a very pleasant stay, I will definitely stay here again when I need to fly out of LAX.<//Review>< Resp>

< Review>
After reading so many amazing reviews I was confident that  I booked  an incredible5 day   stay at the Sheraton LAX and couldn't wait to check in after my long 6 hour flight from NJ. Unfortunately I was highly disappointed when I arrived. See below a list of my disappointments

-Although I booked a king bed and paid premium to make sure I was comfortable I was assigned a Queen bed. I called the front desk and they claim the Queen bed  is their version of King bed. I was beyond frustrated because at the time I was pregnant and had to share the bed with my toddler and husband. In addition they should not advertise king bed if it's Queen bed

- I found a bottle of sunflower seeds in an old Gatorade bottle under the bed

- the toilet seat was never cleaned when I arrived and looked dirty. It was very obvious.

- I ordered room service and one movie for the first night. The hotel had the audacity to charge my card $500 the next morning. When I inquired about the reason for this outrageous charge they claimed they assumed I will
Order everyday  for my entire stay and they estimated $500 based on the fact that my intial bill was $100 and I was booked for 5 days

- the morning buffet has no variety is over priced.

Overall my experience has turned me completely off and I will never ever ever recommend this hotel. I couldn't wait to go back home. I traveled to go to a wedding and I didn't realize it was All star weekend so all of the hotels were booked and I couldn't change at last minute without paying over $2500 for 5 days Worst mistake ever</Review>

< Text>
BEWARE, this is a 2-3 star hotel at most! It might meet some vague criteria to be called a "4 star hotel", but the quality of the hotel does not live up at all.

4.	Service:
Poor signage outside and no associates outside to explain where to park or explain anything.
The staff inside seem more interested in their personal conversation or phone than customer service.

5.	D√©cor:
The outside looks ghetto with cars randomly parked everywhere including along every curb and filling up any open piece of pavement even if it is not an actual parking space just so the hotel can maximize ability to valet cars and get more money.
The lobby looks ransacked as its practically empty with no furniture or art. The carpeting is dingy.
I got off on the 4th floor to what seemed to also be very dated carpeting and wallpaper. There was an attempt to cover up the smell of smoke in the walls/carpeting but ultimately made it worse.

6.	The room
Yes it was big, and it wasnt disgusting, but everything about it seemed cheap. It was subtle at first, but Pieces of furniture didnt line up well, the lamp shades were dirty, most pieces of furniture were a fake wood/plastic with peeling laminate.< /Text>

<Name>Nicole31</Name><Date>1484611200000</Date><Rating>None<//Rating>< review>
Enjoyed a weekend here with my young son. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room was spacious enough for us and the bathroom was satisfactory. There was no tub so if traveling with very small children be sure to inquire about that if needed. We arrived at midnight and were able to still get food from the restaurant which was great. We were upgraded to the club floor which made me feel very secure since key access is needed. We were unable to access the club lounge, however our rate included breakfast in the hotel restaraunt. The breakfast buffet was somewhat limited for me, as I prefer more vegetarian options, however there was lots of fresh fruit and yogurts so I was still very satisfied. You can hear the airport from the hotel, however I didn't find this to disrupt our sleep. The location was also great; Santa Monica, Venice Beach, Downtown, Griffith Park, Runyon Canyon, and Beverly Hills were all less than an hour away.<//review>

<time>1520553600000< /time>< Text>
I have stayed at this hotel for some 20 years plus! So I have seen the changes. And while some are good, some needs improvement. The 2 major areas are by the house keepers noise in the morning, and the breakfast buffet. On my last visit at around 8:20 am i was awoken to the house keeper knocking on all the doors of the rooms nearby "housekeeping-housekeeping" That needs to stop or at least not start until after 10 am. We are in the 21st century folks, have a report that shows rooms are checked out or vacant! The other area is the breakfast buffet. At $28 it is overpriced and should have additional items for kosher dieters like salmon lox. You will do better by selling that buffet at $19.

! will say that other than those 2 areas the hotel is excellent and the staff goes abaove and beyond to help. I will continue to recommend this hotel and look forward to staying again soon.< /Text>

< Text>
I had a beautiful room on the 9th floor for a 3 day 2 night Christmas get a way. It is the last Christmas with our daughter as a teenager before she leaves for college. Her words precisely! We were very happy with our nonsmoking room until our room was flooded with cigarette smoke from a neighboring room. My daughter has asthma and it became very uncomfortable. My husband said that it would be okay. He left for the front desk to report our situation and it was not 10 minutes before he was back with keys for our new room. What service. They accommodated us as soon as possible. I was shocked that it was so fast. We spent Christmas eve and Christmas in our beautiful room. We had a wonderful holiday and the smoking won't even make it to our holiday memories. We will be back Thanks Sheraton Ocean Gate!!!!<//Text>

< user_name>

<Response>None</Response>< GmapID>
0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</GmapID>
<pictures>None</pictures>< review>
WARNING. AVOID THE ROOMS WITH HAVE ADJOINING DOORS. YOU CAN HEAR EVERYTHING YOUR NEIGHBOUR SAYS. EVEN WITHOUT THIS WALLS ARE NOT INSULATED VERY WELL. 

Hotel has been completely renovated and the rooms are great as are the staff, but one thing I noticed during my stay is the hotel sales team are focused on large groups. In this case, you convention goers who as would any young person be focused on the meeting in the day and partying at night. I got a great upgrade to a suite, but what I did not realize was the room had an adjoining door. Well I can honestly say it was the worse case of sound transfer I have ever had in a hotel anywhere in the world. The noise began at 8pm. Teens running up and down the halls, screaming. Running into each others rooms. Then the adjoining room became party central. I put up with it until 10pm then called the front desk. I must have called 10 times and only twice did they actually answer. I let the call ring a FULL 5 MINUTES on one occassion and no one picked up. This was 11pm so I went down to the front desk. I expressed my unhappiness with the situation and wanted to move to another room but there were no rooms left that did not have this adjoining feature. Why for the life of me the hotel during renovations did not insulate and close off these horrible noise transfering doors is beyond me. It is obviously a problem because the staff confirmed it and as I was expressing my frustration at 11pm at the front desk another woman was in tears over exactly the same situation! This is a BIG problem for this hotel and I would remedy it stat. One room at a time. Get those adjoining doors removed. The staff were clearly as frustrated as I was. They have to deal with it everyday I was told!! Imagine dealing with something they have no control over daily when the problem could be fixed by management. 
Great hotel, great staff, good location near LAX. Just make sure you avoid any adjoining rooms upgrade or no upgrade. NOT WORTH THE AGGREVATION. I also think the sales team needs to be more selective about the age groups they focus on at the hotel. It is clearly a business oriented hotel and the sales team should be focused that way and not taking anything just to fill rooms. You will lose more Platinum and Gold customers that it is worth if you continue down this path. Just sayin.</review>

< time>
1476316800000</time>
<name>highlandlassie</name><Text>I stayed two nights here while in transit at LAX. Outside the arrivals area you will find the complimentary shuttle bus. Be aware though that the Sheraton doesnt necessarily have their hotel sign on the front of the bus but on the side of the vehicle. The congestion at LAX airport is horrendous so keep your eyes open for your shuttle. 
At check in there were not enough staff members to check in the guests which resulted in a 10min wait. I was allocated an adjoining room which turned out to be a nightmare. I had two very loud female neighbours who probably thought they were the only people staying on the entire floor. The soundproofing between adjoining rooms is next to nothing. I turned the A/c up to full and it helped drown out some of their noise. 
I returned again one week later but this time stayed in a Club room without an adjoining room and it made such a difference. Breakfast in the Club Lounge was adequate.
The rooms are comfortable and nicely designed. The bed was very comfortable. Complimentary bottled water is provided. The lights cannot be turned off from the bed but must be turned off indivdually which is a bit annoying. Why not have a master switch near the bed?
I had the buffet breakfast once while I stayed there but I wasnt impressed with the quality of the food. It seemed to be more about the quantity than quality. There is a Starbucks cafe located in the lobby which turned out to be the better option. I would stay here again because of the airport proximity but make sure this time that I am not allocated an adjoining room.<//Text>< Pictures>

<UserId.>105671526178142822524</UserId.><username>Z. Cai<//username>< time>
1556330986151< /time>
<Rating>5< /Rating><Review>Surprisingly great, reasonably priced when I was there and with a number of convenient policies.

Quite a few things to like about this hotel. The location, which is amenable for daily car rentals if you're so inclined and so very close the airport. It's actually also quite convenient for exploring a large portion of LA. Hollywood, beaches and various museums are all with an half-hour drive. There's a selection of restaurants and fast food very close by, and it's close to the airport (an airport shuttle runs frequently).

The room we had was fairly well appointed, with logical positioning of furniture and outlets. The room had plenty of space. Washroom had plenty of space to lay out items. TV was fairly modern (although not a smart TV). Lighting was good for a hotel. The view of the runway was great for planespotting. The airplanes are largely unnoticeable once you get used to them and there's a low noise period at night which helps.

The facilities in the hotel were well maintained. A good variety of equipment in the large gym. The pool area was very convenient for those rest days and the hot tub was relaxing to lounge in. We didn't have any food in the restaurant, but the food in the lounge was excellent. During the evening there was a good selection of food which reasonably serve as dinner. The lounge itself was very beautiful and never crowded during our time there. The hotel had microwaves on every floor which was very convenient.

Service was the only area where the hotel was a little weaker, it was good but not great.

Overall, I thought that the hotel provided excellent value, and I would definitely return if I were in LA.</Review><Pictures>None</Pictures><response>{'time': 1556293533801, 'text': "Thank you for your five-stars, Z. Cai. We look forward to your return and we hope it's soon!"}</response>< gmap_id>

< Review>
Want to check in? Plan on waiting 20 minutes and forget about any SPG benefits while waiting. 

Want to order room service? Plan on another 20 minutes to for somebody to answer the phone, then an hour and half for food.

Want to call the front desk? Don't hold your breath, as they may not answer.

Want to listen to airplanes all night? Stay at the Sheraton Gateway next door to LAX.

I stay at SPG properties over 100+ nights a year and this is hands down the most poorly run hotel in the SPG family and grossly understaffed. They don't seem to care if you ever come back.<//Review>

Beautiful hotel with friendly staff and excellent food service. I attended through a special conference comprising nearly 700 community college students.  The conference went off without any problems and it was honestly a lovely experience.

<user_name>trcamp< /user_name><date>1497225600000<//date><rate>None< /rate>< review>
This hotel has beautiful rooms, wonderful staff, and an especially modern pool area - but for anyone flying out of LAX, the location is almost impossible to beat. The front desk told me to plan for 15-20 minutes from the hotel to my terminal; however, my shuttle was pretty empty so I was there in easily under 10 minutes. As anyone who often flies out of LAX knows, traffic is extremely unpredictable, so being able to stay at a hotel that is practically on airport property is invaluable. This, in addition to the overall great experience that the Sheraton provides, makes it a property I'll definitely be returning to.</review>

<text>I want to personally recognize Brenda Reynoso. During my last visit, my family joined me. As it is summer, after my business meetings, we were taking the children to Disneyland. During our stay, my daughter left behind her beloved bear (who has been by her side since she was 9 days old). "Bear" has traveled extensively with us over the years (my daughter is now 13) and we realized he was missing upon our unpacking at Disney. After repeated calls to Sheraton Gateway housekeeping team, I was not confident that the staff had or were looking for Bear. I contacted Micheal Washinton's office and was immediately helped by Brenda Reynoso, who was understanding, and sympathetic. After 2 days of non-responsiveness from the Housekeeping team (including the Housekeeping Manager) Brenda called me back within 20 minutes of our call, with news that she believed bear to have been found. She took possession of Bear, sent a photo of him to us via text (on her own personal phone) and then set up how we could collect him. <Review>While waiting on the SPG Platinum line for not even 3 minutes, the Manager came out and saw we were waiting and personally checked us in to speed things along. As someone who travels frequently and accustomed to waiting in line for check-in, this was quite impressive.

While we had an early flight and did not have time for breakfast, we did enjoy the Club floor evening snacks and there was a good selection. The Sheraton Fitness Center is also quite good at this hotel.

I also was able to return my rental car and walk just 10 minutes back to the hotel without having to take the rental car shuttle or hotel shuttle. And the valet attendant was kind to let me briefly park my rental car while checking-in so I did not have to handle any luggage.

Thanks for a terrific stay and the impressive service.< /Review>< pictures>

<Rate>None<//Rate>< Text>
This hotel is close to LAX (you could walk if you wanted), our room was clean and comfortable and quiet, despite the closeness of the airport. The staff was courteous and there is Starbucks in the hotel if you want something quick for breakfast. We ate the breakfast buffet one morning which was very good with a nice variety (although no made-to-order eggs) and it was kept freshly supplied. There is a shuttle to/from airport as well. One of the best features is the fitness center - they have several treadmills, bicycles,etc. and weights and a stretching area - very nice.</Text>
