< review>
Our stay at the Sheraton Gateway was very nice. We booked a room on New Year's Eve on a whim and for the price we got much more than what we expected. The rooms are nicely appointed with modern furnishings and our view wasn't too bad on the sixth floor. The only downfall and why would not give it five stars is the prison style toilet paper they use. It's a very harsh one ply that isn't even found in a Knights Inn (I'm told). Needless to say I was thoroughly disappointed when using that very necessary product. I wouldn't subject my worst enemy that kind of abuse. Aside from that it was a very comfortable nightd sleep. The airport was unnoticeable as far as sound goes and the hotel itself is very current, clean, inviting and loaded with friendly employees including Rimbi the robot who will bring small toiletries to your room. I highly recommend this hotel keeping in mind you should bring your own toilet paper.</review>

<review>Last night I needed a hotel close to LAX and decided to stay at this Sheraton. Though the hotel is not fancy, it is clean, and up to date. What set this stay apart from the many hotels I stay in was the service. 

When I checked around 10pm I asked for an early wake up call from the front desk person. As we were chatting I also explained I needed a good night sleep, and though he had already cut keys, took them back and said, "Let's move you to the quiet side". Not facing a runway. Sure enough the room was quiet and I got a much needed couple of hours of sleep.

It ends up, I woke up on my own around 5am for an early flight. Hopped in the shower and decided I would head to the airport early and grab some breakfast in case LAX was a mess. As I am leaving my room at 5:30, who is walking towards me, but the same front desk manager. He said they had a power outage that effected the phone system so he was coming to my room to provide a personal wake up call. 

This is the type of service that will make me stay at this property next time I am in LA and need a place by the airport.< /review>< pictures>

<Rating>None<//Rating><Date>1372204800000<//Date><Response>None</Response><Text>The hotel itself is very clean and the staff is courteous. The bed mattresses are nowhere near as comfortable as I had hoped for, but the bedding/pillows were very comfortable. You could tell the rooms were older, but again very clean. I wished the sink/vanity were separate from the toilet and shower. Just makes it easier to get ready if you're sharing a room. The views are not very good. The pool area is alot smaller than what appeared online, but still very nice. I liked the Paparazzi restaurant at the hotel, it was very good and the staff were excellent. The hotel does provide a shuttle to Manhattan beach and the mall for a small fee. Other than that, there is no place within walking distance. I found some of the concierges hard to understand due to heavy accents. I'm not sure if I'd stay at this particular hotel again, only because of the location. <review>A shuttle that runs every 15 minutes, 24 hours a day, is a huge plus. On a layover from Hong Kong, being able to check out at 2 pm the next day was appreciated. Room was very clean and tidy. <Text>Good Customer Service. It is located by the Airport so if you are a light sleeper you may want to stay at a further Hotel. The only 2 issue we really encountered were the parking there is a lot behind the hotel and if you are parking for the night it is $17.50 but not in and out. <Resp>None</Resp><pics>None< /pics><text>We found the staff to be friendly but nervous. Whether anxious to please, or afraid of meeting employer demands was unclear. 

The desk staff was unequivocally friendly, the room was nice, the hotel was clean, and the soundproofing against the airport noise was outstanding. 

However, there were two rather big negatives:
1) The bar was refusing to use glassware (even though it was displayed in typical bar fashion), opting instead for plastic. To be served a $15 premium martini type drink in a plastic cup was ridiculous. The first time we were told no glasses were being used, the manager was nearby and he overrode the plastic dictum. We weren't so lucky the next day; it helped reduce our bar bill considerably, though. No explanation was given as to why they were substituting plastic for glass, but the bar was hopping and the hotel very full. I think they were pinching pennies on staff and their water bill, but that is just a guess.
2) The offer to "go green" by skipping maid service for a day is a sham. For years, we have "gone green" by simply re-hanging our towels instead of dropping them on the floor; now "going green" means you will not get your coffee in the room, the trash emptied, or have any other amenities refreshed; but the biggest effect is on another kind of "green": The impact on the paychecks of the housekeeping staff, as well as tip income, could be significant, and I do not approve of this type of business practice, especially considering the fact that this is not a budget hotel.<//text><gmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /gmapID><rating>None</rating><date>1496620800000< /date><username>RRanger</username>< userid>

< Review>
After months of looking around for hotels to celebrate my husband's birthday as we land in LA, i called Sheraton and booked the Sheraton Gateway Hotel.
Firstly i took the romance package which mentioned we will get wine and chocolate covered strawberries as we get in. We didn't receive that. Since it was a surprise i couldn't correct the front desk. After few minutes of settling down i went back to front desk and showed her the confirmation. She was very reluctant to call for the wine and chocolates as if she is doing a big favor. No apologies nothing. Then we waited for 3 hrs to get the wine and strawberries. All our evening plans had to be cancelled because whenever i was calling, they said its coming up, they are preparing the fruit as if they grew the strawberries and prepared the chocolate. Very disappointing. In this the surprise was wasted.
Secondly, while booking i requested for a birthday cake which had another story for which i had mailed earlier. Anyways i brought the cake myself and asked help of room service and concierge and delivering it to the room at midnight. The concierge representative that time was very unhelpful. When i brought my cake, his expression was "Thats it"... I was so embarrassed. Since it was only 2 of us i bought very small cakes so that food is not wasted. Anyways i was requesting him to bring up the cake to the room but at first it was so difficult to make him understand. Not sure if he had English understanding problem. Then he was going on coercing me to come down and get the cake myself. I tried to reason with him for room service since it was a surprise but then i was totally disappointed with the service and decided to take care of it myself.
Thirdly, the spa was so dirty. We went in to check and there was so much of hair and filthy. Looked like the water was not circulating properly. I took a picture as well in-case you need proof.
Fourthly, we had free WiFi included in package and the front desk didn't bother to let us know how to access. We were trying to login and it was showing a charge of around $12, then when we called the front desk, they said how to access. Not acceptable at all. Front desk should know what all information to provide to customers. Whatever is included int he package should be known to the front desk.
Fifth, the breakfast wasn't that good. There were varieties but not up to the standard.
Only thing i liked is the proximity of hotel to LAX and the STARBUCKS store.< /Review>

< review>
When we arrived at the Sheraton LAX, we were exhausted and looking forward to a night of rest before we headed off to Europe. When we arrived and went to the check-in desk, we were barely greeted by a very rude clerk. When I gave him my name for the booking, he looked at his computer for about two seconds and said, "Nope, you're not in the system." Baffled, I asked him to please check again, and got my SPG card out. "Yeah it's not in here, and that card won't help you," he said. He asked for the reservation number but I could not locate this; I stated that I found it odd they couldn't look up reservations by NAME, and he just brushed us off saying there was nothing more he could do.

We took a seat in the lobby and I proceeded to call my credit card company just to confirm we'd made the booking as we had paid in advance. After 15 minutes of phone calls, I finally got my booking number and proceeded to the desk. This time, we were met by a manager who AGAIN could not find our booking - even with our reservation number! By this time my husband was fed up and demanded to speak to someone else. We were presented with a senior manager, who magically found our booking after a few seconds of looking at the computer and suddenly declared us "Guests of the Day!" It seems they realized their mistake and this was a futile attempt to win us back.

There was no explanation given as to why the first two clerks could not find our booking, nor did either of the two apologize. The senior manager was very nice and did all he could to make us feel comfortable, including letting us know that he would be sending us a credit of 7000 SPG points to my account for our trouble. We appreciated this gesture and had a decent night in the hotel.

Well it's 6 weeks later and no sign of our points. Numerous emails to the senior manager have resulted in more empty promises from him to transfer these points. I have, in writing, his promise, but so far we've received nothing.

The whole experience has really put us off to the Sheraton and in Starwood hotels in general. We feel the "Guest of the Day" declaration and the promise of points were based on nothing other than making us happy in the moment - delivering on that promise has been another matter all together.<//review>

<Time>1476576000000<//Time><Rating>None<//Rating><text>I have stayed at this hotel 10-15 times in the last 3 years. This is my favorite LA hotel that is reasonably priced for LA. If you want an ocean view and a wallet gouge, try Le Meridien, or hip Hollywood flair and a wallet gouge try W Hollywood. 

I love this hotel. It has a great club lounge that is always stocked with soda, coffee, teas, snacks, etc. There is a hot breakfast in the club lounge every morning and appetizers in the evening. 

The staff are all amazing. The only time I had any issues, they immediately made it right. The last stay I was recovering from surgery and went to the hotel from the hospital. They were quick to check us in and it was great to recover watching the planes land, enjoying room service, and watching the newest movies. 

The only down side is that I always select make a green choice on my reservations and I just noticed that I did not get the points for that automatically. Some hotels you have to remind them at check out. I'm sure though when I contact them it will be fixed.

I noticed one review mentioned cigarette smoke. I am also super sensitive and I've never had that come up in all of my stays there. It must have been a guest in the next room or something as I've not had that experience.<//text>< gmap_id>
0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</gmap_id>

<user_id>None</user_id><gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</gmap_id><Text>Over the past 6 months, I have been staying at this hotel pretty regularly with colleagues for business meetings. The service at the front desk has slowly and noticeably depreciated in quality and efficiency. My last stay at Sheraton Gateway was at the end of August 2012, and it took me over an hour to finally check-in to my room. The issue started with me not being able to get access to the first room I was assigned. I mention to the woman ( will not be named) who checked me in that my access cards do not work, and I believe it was actually occupied because of the dirty dishes in front of the door and the noise I can hear from outside of the room. She assigned me another room, and as I had requested from the beginning, in not having a connected room to the ones next door, she promised me that the room will not be connected. My second time up the elevator led me to a room that was connected. I went downstairs, to remedy this situation (going back to the same front desk staff) for the 3rd try. Again, she sent me back up to a room that is connected. Normally I don‚Äôt have an issue with these mistakes, but her reluctance to believe that these rooms were connected irritated me. She insisted that in her system, these rooms were both unoccupied (from the first time) and not connected to other rooms (second and third time). By the fourth time, I requested to speak to the manager on duty.
Before the manager on duty (will also not be named on this open review) came to speak to me, the woman at the front desk begin asking the cleaning ladies to check the vacant rooms that was not connected on the SPG Club level. 10-15 minutes passed before they settled me in on the 5th floor- clearly indicating that there is an issue of (1) she (staff) does not know how to book a room that is vacant and not connected or (2) something is wrong with the current Sheraton Gateway System. Regardless of this situation with this staff and the system, I brought this to the attention of the manager on duty. I believe he offered to have someone bring me my luggage to my room, and to compensate me 4k points. I deny the help of staff carrying me luggage (and expressed my feeling that this should have been offered the second time, if not the third time they send me up to my assigned room). I also hope that the manager did not mean 4k points for my inconvenience that day; rather something more substantial, because 4k points isn‚Äôt nearly enough to even land me one free night at this hotel. Either way, I have yet to see any compensation in the points that the manager has offered. Overall, I am greatly disappointed with the performance of this hotel in their apparent decline of quality service at the front desk.</Text>< rating>

< Review>
Shortly after checking into our room, we noticed a very bad smell in our floor's hallway near our room. I reported this to guest services. They indicated that a housekeeper would be up there to freshen up the area. I had to call a second time as the smell worsened and they assured me it would be taken care of. Finally, on a third call, I asked to be moved to another room. The third person I spoke with was very nice and promptly sent a bellman to our room with new keys. I had to return to the room for one more item. At that time there was a member of the housekeeping staff and also there were two security staff at the door of the person who was causing the issue. It was nice to see they were taking action to remove the cause. The security staff members were dressed very professionally and asked me some questions as I passed by. I felt confident that they would handle the situation. The new room was satisfactory although the bathroom door would not completely shut. The rooms felt clean and well stocked. Most of the staff at front desk was helpful - one, however, made us feel rushed as he was trying to get us out of the way so he could help an SPG guest who walked up behind us. Dining staff nice - we got an incorrect item, they corrected it right away. The housekeeping staff member I met in the hallway was very nice. The valet staff member out front was very helpful and friendly. The free airport shuttle was primarily the reason we chose this airport and it worked out well though we did have to wait a bit for the shuttle. But we anticipated this and arrived out front early. Overall despite the "incident" we encountered after check in - it was a pleasant stay, the food in the restaurant was good, staff helpful and friendly and the convenience to the airport would prompt me to recommend it and to stay again when I have the need to do so.<//Review>

< text>
This is my hotel of choice for LAX stays and early morning flights to JFK. I was upgraded to a beautiful EXECUTIVE SUITE with a view of LAX.

POSITIVES: Beautiful hotel located close to LAX. Airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes 24/7. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The lobby is huge and spacious.

NEGATIVES: Shower has low pressure and the tubs are rather small. Overall even the bathrooms in the executive suites are small. The suites are totally not sound proof and I could clearly hear the conversation between a couple in the adjacent room. Ear muffs helped.

DINING: I ate at PAPARAZZI and the service along with the food was great. Beware of a lot of "Drunkos" who are sitting at the bar trying to muster up a conversation and showing you pictures of their "Model girlfriends'

STAFF: Very efficient and pleasing

OVERALL: Great choice for frequent travelers with early morning LAX flights.

This is truly a LAX favorite for me.<//text>

<Gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /Gmap_id>< Review>
My experience with this Sheraton hotel was exceptional. It had everything I needed to randomly explore all things LA; from downtown to the coast. The staff was friendly and kind with my needs; esp. the front desk who was most helpful in helping me have the best stay possible. I stayed for two nights. Both nights were undisturbed, as I had requested. The bus line was well within walking distance making exploring easy and inexpensive. The pool area was a bit small as advertised in their photographs; however, it was not crowded during my stay, so it didn't matter. I ordered room service on my first night, and the server was very friendly. The only downside of my stay was the washroom. It was clean; however, the toiletries were scattered about and not neatly kept. To me, it looked messy based on my other stays at other Sheratons.

Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying only a few days in the LAX area.<//Review>

< Review>
This Sheraton location is by far the worst hotel I have ever had to do business with. I have employees staying at this hotel constantly. If it wasn't for the group rate/block that I have to use, I'd definitely use other lodging arrangements. Calling here is a nightmare. I've been transferred to no less than 5 different extensions for the same request. Billing is a nightmare, requesting and receiving a credit card authorization is like pulling teeth. Once I finally get a hold of someone, I either don't get the email or get it days later. Even after a credit card authorization is sent, quite often my employees arrive and are told none are on file(even after I had called the previous week to confirm receipt). Other times they are charged on their own card instead, even though a credit card authorization is on file. The operator is normally short and transfers without even responding after I state what I need. The front desk staff are very friendly but often it takes 10 minutes or more before they answer after I am transferred. I book hotels weekly and deal with hundreds of hotels, none compare to this nightmare.</Review>

<text>I am an avid traveller and a big SPG fan. I chose Sheraton Gateway for a quick layover between two international flights due to its proximity to the airport. I landed at 11:30PM and waited for the shuttle 20 minutes and finally after all shuttles had gone twice the sheraton/Joes parking shuttle shows up. The van is full and no space to sit. Once we reach the hotel, the people at the bell desk are chatting and no one comes up to help with luggage. When I reported this attitude to the front desk, they were very politely dismissive. I disregard this as maybe a late night thing. Next day morning, I had to catch the flight. I wait for the shuttle and the same issue. I eventually find out that they have outsourced the shuttle service to the neighboring parking service and they juggle between their clients and Sheraton's guests. This is not expected of a 4 star hotel. I am disappointed and would not recommend to anyone thinking of this as an option for proximity to airport.<//text>< pictures>
None<//pictures>
<response>None<//response><gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

<user_id>116879967410274566789</user_id>< Text>
This was the cleanest hotel I've stayed in ever. Usually hotel beds and towels have this nasty smell, but not this place. Everything in the room smelled legitimately clean which is the most important thing to me. Nice looking hotel with a bar downstairs. For parking, you can pay 40-something dollars for valet or $17 a day to park across the street. It had a beautiful clean bathroom and a flat screen tv. No free breakfast, but there's a Starbucks in the lobby. It's right by the airport but the planes didn't bother me. The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it didn't have a fridge and microwave. Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay and definitely recommend it.</Text>

<Rating>4<//Rating>< review>
Would have given a 3.5 if there were an option. The beds are comfortable, the restaurant food is decent, the rooms are pretty quiet (or no one was on either side of us), and the building is pretty nice but they're missing a few key features: WiFi in the rooms is not free, some electrical sockets do not work, no refrigerator in the room, and the shower pressure is low. We called for toothpaste twice and was told someone was coming but they never did; however, I won't count it against them because the front desk is very busy as it's such a big hotel. Great view of the city at night and many places to eat nearby. Not such a bad place to be. The hotel was paid for by work, so take it with a grain of salt.</review>

< Text>
We have stayed at this hotel twice now after coming back from long flights to Asia Pacific and needed some down time for a day or two to get our body clocks back on track. Staff and service are excellent and any needs were met immediately. We would definitely stay again at this hotel while into LAX. We upgraded to the Club Lounge so easy walk on our floor for free breakfast and appies in the afternoon. Free internet was also included. < Text>
Arrived at the hotel on 21st September after a late flight from London. Shuttle bus arrived after about five minutes and we were greeted by a very effusive driver who "welcomed us to LA". Five minutes later we arrived at the hotel and all the check in desks were quickly opened so check in was very swift. Got an upgrade to a corner room on my Starwood Gold card. Breakfast, [included in my rate] was excellent with a good choice of fruit, fried breakfast etc. Check out was also very efficient.

Having stayed at LAX several times this is without doubt the best of the airport hotels. Combine a great rate for the room, including two breakfasts, $129, booked direct with Sheraton on the web and you cannot go wrong.

Everything above expectation so definately will return on the next LA trip.</Text>

We were treated like stars! Upgraded to Executive Suite and free parking thrown in on top of that. <Text>I loved that the hotel was 5 minutes from the airport. It was so easy for travel and I was pleased to see how close we were to the beach! <Rating>1< /Rating><Text>Booked a one night stay for a concert I attended. At first, it was great. Based on my stay and the hotel itself, I would've given 4-5 stars. However, shortly after checking out, I noticed that the hotel charged me an additional $500 (mind you I prepaid for the room and my deposit had already been taken out when I checked in). I hadn't gotten any type of phone call, receipt or e-mail correspondence in regards to the charge. When I called the hotels accounting department, I was told that the $500 charge was to cover damages to the desk in the room. I didn't even use the desk. I used the bathroom to get ready in and the bed to sleep in for a short period of time. That was ALL. I went on to request further details in regards to the damage, because I knew for fact that it was not a result of my stay in the room. After waiting for a day, the associate who was helping me e-mailed me a photo of the damage. It literally looked like someone angrily took a knife to the surface of the desk. I was then told that if I wanted to dispute the charge I would have to contact my bank. I explained that I would not be contacting my bank because of their staffs incompetence. Clearly, upon the previous guests check out, the cleaning staff (or whoever) didn't do a well enough job checking for damages, so they decided to assume the damage came from me just so that they could get money out of someone. I totally understand if I were responsible for the damages. In that case, I would've brushed it off and taken the responsibility because I am an honest person. I asked to speak to a supervisor because it wasn't fair to have to go through a 30-day dispute with my bank to only hope for my money back that paid for someone else's damage to their property. Ultimately, and with a fight, I was granted a refund. But, I am completely turned off by the way this was handled. I would've appreciated being contacted by someone before $500 was wrongfully charged to my debit card without explanation and not being (basically) told to deal with it when I called to complain. Horrible customer service in that aspect. I will never visit this hotel again.< /Text>< pictures>

0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /GmapID>
</record></dataset><record>
< Text>
I spent two nights here after flying out for a business meeting - which was ironically cancelled just as I landed, so I spent all my time at the hotel.

The lobby is spacious, with the front desk immediately accessible, and a dedicated line for flight crews given it‚Äôs proximity. I was immediately able to skip the queue in the Platinum line, and was given an upgrade to a larger room facing the south side of the runway.

Yes, the hotel is VERY close to the airport, nestled near the end of the north runways, and above the south. I had a great view to watch the planes taking off - as a traveller, I do enjoy that!

Noise was not an issue - the south runways were far enough way to be a dim humming, which I was grateful for and surprised about.

Standard Sheraton room - spacious with a sitting and working area, although it seemed to have an older TV cabinet more suited for a CRT TV (slide-out tray style).

Lounge was a fair size larger than a standard Sheraton lounge, and offered evening hors-d‚Äôouvre and a continental breakfast. I always appreciate a lounge with a mini-fridge of water bottles, never drinking the tap water, and it was constantly being refilled. Food was good - and being at an international airport, also had some Asian food choices.

Internet speed was great, but the biggest features I liked were the gym and the pool.

Despite being an airport hotel, it has a sizable pool and hot tub, and great sunlight during the day. The gym is also more of a rectangle on the main floor, with the main cardio machines facing out a long row of windows onto the pool deck. No staring at the wall!

Highly recommend this hotel for an overnight at LAX, or even if you‚Äôre on business / visiting the south side of LA.< /Text>

< Review>
It's tough to be an airport hotel, but the Sheraton LAX manages to do a great job and providing a full-service experience in a difficult environment. I love being able to walk directly from the airport without taking a bus, and the hotel has multiple restaurants, comfortable conference facilities, and an attractive gym and pool. Staff make every effort to be helpful. I've stayed at a few other properties along Century Blvd, but this one is easily the best.<//Review>

< text>
We stayed at this hotel due to it's close proximity to LAX and our early morning flights the next day. We checked in on a Sunday 6/29 to get a good night's sleep and utilize the shuttle service the next morning.

Check in was fine - the front desk even gave us a complementary credit at the beginning to try the hotel ammenities....this is where the trouble began.

We had dinner in the hotel lounge (Rendezvous) and while the food was very overpriced, we accepted that for what it was ($$$$ for 2 kids meals, a split of a fish and chips, a house wine and 2 draft beers) but upon checkout, we noticed that the our portfolio was charged 3 times for the same $$$$$. We recognized the mistake before we left the hotel and the front desk supposedly corrected the error.

Unfortunately, the next day (7/1), the hotel went ahead and reprocessed the overcharge again. I saw the cahrge on my AMEX and left multiple messages for the business office with no reply. I finally spoke to the manager on duty last week and spent 20 minutes on the phone with him as well explaining the issue. He apologized and said the credit would be processed ASAP and I would receive an acknowedgement once it was corrected.

As of 7/16 at 937am local time - no credit - no email - no response - I had no choice but to waste even more time and contest the charge with AMEX but at least I know it will get corrected now and I would be stuck paying $$$$ multiple times for 3 not very good meals.

Dissapointing. This experience with the business office took what should have been a good stay and soured the entire trip.

CHECK YOUR PORTFOLIO CAREFULLY and check your statement to ensure you were not overcharged by the hotel.< /text>

< review>
The location is very convenient to LAX. Great comfortable beds, though I feel the bathrooms needs a relooking.
The Paparazzi restaurant has a very nice atmosphere, good Italian food and excellent service from Oracio who recognizes his returning guests. Outstanding!
Very nice pool area if one has the time. Good roomy gym overlooking the pool area. Best LAX hotel to me, and it's a real pleasure to see the same staff every time I return. Friendly and good valet service.
The negative would be the lounge. Used to be much better. Running out of food 45 mins before closing time, not good.<//review>

<rating>None<//rating>< text>
This has been one of my favorite places to stay in LA. However, I have begun to notice a downward trend in the service and amenities over the past few stays. The club lounge used to be always open for a cup of coffee, or bottle of water or even just a spot to relax. Now, if you don't make it there during certain hours, you're out of luck. I definitely won't waste my money on a room upgrade anymore.
Our room this time didn't even seem to be prepared for our stay. Just two towels, and only one packet of coffee (decaf - yuck!).
Seriously, the shine on this hotel has varnished. It no longer stands out from any of the other hotels in the LAX area. Might as well go for the better price somewhere else.</text>

< user_id>
None< /user_id>
<Name>LifetimePlatinum< /Name><date>1429056000000</date><rating>None< /rating>< Review>
An incredible experience today at The Sheraton Gateway Hotel Los Angeles

What an amazing experience tonight! It's a beautiful story. I moved out of my Florida home This past weekend and spent the last three days releasing 14 years of stuff, memories, things, and the energies of Sage, family, friends, girlfriends, celebrations, and transformations..... The "stuff" we collect and gather is not so hard to release but all the memories and stories tug at the heart chords. I arrived back to LA and a few hours after landing had to bring William on an he long drive through LA traffic to play his hockey game at the Toyota Sports Center. I thought the game was scheduled for 7:30pm but when we arrived I found out it was for 10:30pm which meant I had like 3 hrs to kill.
After flying cross country I decided the best option would be to find a close by Starwood property and just hole up for a few hours in a day room. The Sheraton Gateway Hotel was only 3 miles away so William and I made our way over. When we arrived at the front desk the magic happened! One of those special experiences that is so unique to the Starwood brand.
Upon check in we were greeted with the warm smile of Dajuan. We explained our situation and he took the initiative to secure us a day room (which was later upgraded to a full room.) Dajuan's demeanor was so personable and warm. He made us laugh and feel so welcomed. As we talked we learned that we had shared a great experience about 6 years ago at the W Hotel in Westwood. I had hosted a fundraiser for Haiti with the cast of the show "The Office" and he was there working at the event. Small world! We joked and laughed about the great experience! Then he took the initiative to bring out Mustafa, the Director of Guest Relations. Mustafa had earlier in the day hosted a "departure party" for his Direct Superior that had his last day today. Mustafa shared on a very personal level how he got teary eyed when he made his presentation honoring his business mentor. Somehow that promoted me to share my experience of moving out of my home earlier in the day, and how emotional that was for me, and how appreciative I was to come and have such a warm friendly checking experience. It almost felt like I was coming home to my home away from home. I shared with them the experience of how that all the properties all over the world of travel to, even when you go to a country like Vietnam or Bali, the one thing that's always constant is the treatment and the experience of coming into a Starwood brand Hotel feeling so welcome and appreciated. No matter how strange the culture shock, the consistency of the brand and the respect that Starwood pays to the loyal Starwood members always makes me feel like I'm "home."
That led Mustafa to go even deeper on a personal level, and share with me his family's departure from Pakistan 15 years ago when I moved to this country and how difficult the transition was. When there's an opportunity to have a real human experience, a real connection of spirit and kindred soul, it makes me so proud to be part of Starwood. I just wanted to really take a moment to make a statement, that these two employees exemplify success! They are compassionate, sincere, and authentic. I know that they will have a long and prosperous successful career with Starwood, because they imprint all the other employees on the team and set the example. And as I am a 14 year platinum member and a four-year lifetime platinum member I know excellence when I experience it.

When I was a young man my Godmother Gave me this beautiful ceramic piece that simply said "home sweet home" and she told me... "Wherever you go you can simply set this by your bed... In any hotel room, or camp site, under the stars... Or in a house... And it will remind you that we are always home in ourselves" .... I can only say that we are always "moving" and the places and locations become our sanctuaries.... It is the love and the relationships that make a house a home... And so now I travel on. But I bring the love with me... To discover lands I have never seen and to explore places I have never been... Thank you Starwood for being my travel companion... The experience of Dajuan and Mustafa really made a huge difference in my day today. From leaving the place that I called home for 14 years to arriving to a temporary stop-over there and even just giving me two freshly baked cookies at check-in, reminded me of what my grandmother used to do when I would come to her house. When we know this love we can never feel alone again.

Best regards;
Mitch< /Review>

< Gmap_id>
0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//Gmap_id>
< review>
I stay at this hotel 3-4 times per month and I am consistently pleased with the overall experience. The hotel is well maintained. The fitness center is one of the better facilities you see at an airport hotel. The equipment is well maintained, which is not always the case with properties I frequent. The restaurant and bar staff are very friendly and always remember me and greet me with a smile. Juan who works in the Club Lounge in the mornings is amazing. He is very friendly and always remembers my name. When I walk in for breakfast Juan immediately brings me a glass of skim milk. I cannot say enough about the service provided by Juan. My only complaint is I need to get him to call me by my first name. Front desk staff is very friendly and efficient. The valet recently raised their prices which would be fine if the service provided by the valet was at the same level as the rest of the hotel. The valet is the weak link in the hotel. They are very slow and often times I am waiting to drop off or pick up my vehicle and the valet staff can be seen standing around talking to one another. I find it difficult for the hotel to justify the increase in the price of valet parking. I would be more tolerant if they raised the room night price since I see a greater degree of value with the overall hotel than I do with the valet.<//review>

< rating>

<text>I was a bit hesitant. I never trust properties near airports, especially major international ones. I had visions of dealing with staff who've been yelled at by a few too many jet-lagged travelers, and fears of trying to sleep with the the constant roar of jet engines bombarding my room. Surprisingly, I found none of that. Even though I arrived at a time when it seemed every room in the hotel was being checked in, I never felt rushed or unappreciated. The staff was incredibly courteous and made sure I was well taken care of. When I got to my room I was astounded by how quiet it was. The scenic view of runways was all that there was to remind me of how close the property was to the airport. Well done, Sheraton Gateway. Well done, indeed.<//text><pictures>None</pictures><resp>None<//resp><gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /gmap_id></record></dataset><record>
< rating>

<review>I just want to report that my stay at the LA Gateway was very personable.</review><user>None</user><gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//gmap_id>< Pictures>

<response>None</response><user_name>TVProducer<//user_name><time>1563926400000</time></record></dataset><record>
<UserId.>None<//UserId.>< user_name>
ShaggyMEB</user_name>
<time>1486425600000</time><Rate>None</Rate>< review>
Flying out of LAX the following morning, we opted to stay at the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles the night before our flight. The hotel is conveniently located in a row of hotels right next to LAX, and offers free shuttle service to the airport, making it a great option.

The hotel is huge, over 700 rooms. Not sure when the hotel was last renovated, but it appears to have been recently, as everything looked and felt pretty fresh. The lobby was an absolute madhouse, with lengthy lines to check in and multiple desk agents handling check-ins, but there was no one in the SPG Gold and Platinum check-in line, so thanks to SPG Platinum status, I was checked in and rolling in about five minutes. This is the first time I've ever actually seen the Elite check-in line used effectively, and I was grateful for it on that day. I wish I could remember the desk agent's name, because he was fantastic, welcoming and accommodating.

We were upgraded to a suite thanks to SPG Suite Nights, and the suite was a large corner space overlooking the airport. Plenty of room to spread out (even though we were only there for one night). My only gripe if I was staying long term would be the inability to close off the sleeping space from the rest of the room, because it was really just one huge room with a separate sitting area. I like being able to separate the living area from the sleeping area, but this really wasn't a concern for us since this was basically a crash pad before a flight the next morning. The room was clean and was appointed in standard Sheraton style.

Overall, we found it to be a bit pricey if we were paying rack rates, but wasn't a bad redemption with points. I believe this hotel is also a major conference center, and would work well for such given its size. If you're looking for a good place to crash before heading to the airport, this is a good option.<//review>

<Text>I am currently a lifetime Gold member and come to the LAX area often, for meetings at Los Angeles Air Force Base (I am retired Air Force). In the past, I have enjoyed the club lounge for a quick snack in the morning, which was available when I first became a gold member. Then you changed policies and only let Platinum members go into the club lounge. I eventually become Platinum, but due to recent travel reductions with my company, I lost that level last year. Up until my most recent stay (Jan '13), you provided to me as part of my Government reservation, a complementary b-fast buffet each morning, which I enjoyed. I only ate granola cereal, but it was nice taking my time eating and reading the paper. This past stay, I was told that you no longer provide a free buffet with the Gov't rate. Yes, your hotel is nice, but the amenities that I just discussed is what has brought me back, time after time. I hate to say this, but I'm rethinking my loyalty as you no longer offer what I enjoy. I will be researching different hotel chains to see if they meet my needs, which are very simple, yet very important to me.</Text><pics>None< /pics><resp>None< /resp>< gmap_id>

< text>
I often frequent the SPG hotels near LAX, which is great cause there is four in the area and I always look forward to SPG status. I am so closed to Platinum so I have really just started staying at the hotel for no true purpose beyond upgraded status.

The sad thing is that after so many stays and so many dollars spent most of these SPG hotels do very little beyond offering you points. I have experience the true spirit of the program, however the norm is to stick you in a regular room call it SPG level and debate rather not if you can get the late check out...

My recent stay at this hotel was not that bad, thanks, but there was no room upgrade, no comp parking, just my gift of additional points which tend to be getting smaller and smaller compared to my first race to platinum...I stood in line at the "status-Line" and notice that no one pay attention to me or my facial expression of looking at three people get called before me...its annoying that the dedicated line is too busy calling from the general line...yet it is I who have choosing SPG to be and investment and have earned the status that I would like to be recognized for ...

<rate>None<//rate>< Text>
Spent 3 Nights here. The room was average. The bathroom could use some updating. Very low showerhead and tiles were a bit dirty.

What prevents me from giving the hotel a better rating was the fact that on two separate occasions the Hotel Staff entered my room without knocking. The first time was a housekeeping supervisor who just walked in. The second was a hotel maintenance person entering on the day of my departure even though my DO NOT DISTURB sign was hung on the outside of the door.

I complained to the front desk staff after both occasions. The first time the front desk clerk was apologetic and offered me a complementary breakfast. The second time, the front desk clerk mumbled an apology.

Other than that the hotel was fairly nice- Food in the restaurants was above average and much of the staff was friendly and helpful< /Text>

< review>
My husband and I recently stayed here one night upon returning from Hawaii. We had stayed here before without incident and it is very close to the airport which is convenient and It's comfortable. The following day My husband checked us out at the front desk and returned the key and they asked if he wanted the Folio emailed and he said that would be fine and we received our emailed folio. Two days later we received three more emailed folios with two additional days and a couple of extra charges. I called and whoever answered the first time was NO help whatsoever and I was told to call back two days later and talk to someone in the accounting department because it was a holiday weekend. I ended up calling back later that day and was given a manager. After investigation I was told that housekeeping had said we were still in the room. But he would investigate further and refund and call me back. I did receive a phone call but they didn't leave a message so here I go again calling back. Once again on the first call I got someone who was totally uninterested in helping me and then when I called back again I was put through to another manager and then he put me through to someone else. They kept thinking I had made reservations for three night and I told them that my reservation was only for one night and that I have proof of the reservation. I was finally told that they took 12,000 pts out of my SPG account for the additional nights. I was not happy with that. Then I was finally told that they did have record of us checking out but that someone had checked us back in from the hotel. I asked about the housekeeping story and was told that housekeeping thought we were still in the room. Hummmm if someone was in the room it certainly wasn't us. Then they finally told me they would put my points back in with an additional 3000. And refund us. I'm still waiting to see if that happens. I certainly hope it does and I don't have to call again. Having said all that I'm a bit reluctant to use this hotel again because of this. So I'll probably use another hotel close by. I kept asking what I would need to do in the future to keep this from happening again and I was never given an answer.< /review>

< Review>
I have stayed at this hotel the last three times I visited Los Angeles. Although the room was a tight squeeze on one of my trips (because I was travelling with my spouse and two children), generally the room is very spacious and clean.The staff is always quick to respond to any questions or requests. My last visit, the housekeeping staff actually had to come and strip my linens as my infant had an accident. Not only were they quick to respond but, made sure that I had everything I needed prior to leaving the room. The room service was also quick and courteous. I love this Hotel which is why it is my go to when visiting the Los Angeles area. I feel it is worth every penny. I am returning the week of February 18 and am anticipating the same stellar service. Thank you to all the staff at the Sheraton Gateway.</Review>

<pictures>None</pictures><Review>I had a meeting at this Sheraton, and got in to LAX the night before the meeting. The hotel shuttle bus was quick to arrive and it was a very short trip to the hotel. Check in took about 15 minutes with about 10 people in line served by 3 registration workers. The room was very nicely furnished. My only complaint is that these days, WiFi should not be an additional cost of $13 per day. A renown hotel like Sheraton should offer WiFi at no additional cost to its customers. My only choice for dining was the Papparazzi Ristorante. The lasagna was excellent, but the total bill ran almost $40 including iced tea and gratuity. The meeting venue was nice (Seminar Room), and the breakfast and buffet lunch spread was very tasty. Once again, the shuttle bus had me back to my terminal at LAX within 5 minutes. Overall, it was a very nice stay.</Review><userid>None</userid>< Resp>

<Rating>None< /Rating><text>The Sheraton Gateway has so much potential to be the perfect hotel for a business traveler, but it falls short on a few critical operational elements. While its proximity to LAX is unmatched, it takes forever for a shuttle bus to arrive at the airport. It is common in the evenings that one bus will be running while three sit idle in the parking lot. Next, there is a dedicated SPG line at check in but there is rarely anyone staffing the desk in front of it. The other one or two desks routinely process the non SPG members first while we stand there trying to get their attention. Finally, the internet connection in the rooms often do not work properly and the IT company help desk takes so long it just isn't worth the effort. These few issues mar an otherwise fantastic great value property with friendly service, spacious and comfortable rooms, and good food, especially the room service.< /text>< Pics>

< Review>
This hotel has potential to be so much better.

1) they charge a ridiculous amount for valet parking. Not great for residents with cars in a city where you need a car.

2) despite the fancy looking reception and reasonably high level service from front desk the hotel corridors (5th floor) smell funky and are crying out for a new carpet.

Although the rooms are a good size and there is a decent fridge and a TV which is just far too big. There are other issues.

3) The curtains don‚Äôt close properly in the centre and either side and this lets daylight in, not great if you‚Äôre jet lagged.

4) there is no kettle in the room, just a coffee maker which isn‚Äôt great if you want tea. Although Starbucks in reception were great at providing hot water. Inconvenienced yet.

5) the only mirror in the room is situated behind the bathroom door and in the smallest space of the entire room. Not great.

6) the pool is nice, the sun beds are a little old and there is loose gravel on the surface of the pool area which isn‚Äôt nice if you‚Äôre bare footed. There are a couple of big annoying trees blocking parts of the lounge area.

Positives are, good gym, decent equipment and open 24/7. Nice enough staff. good location to airport but with annoying parking cost and outdated parts of the hotel I‚Äôd stay elsewhere next time.</Review>

< Name>
theroadwetraveled</Name>
<Date>1340236800000</Date>< Rate>
None<//Rate>
<gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /gmap_id><user>None<//user>< Review>
Let me start off with the fact that I travel frequently both internationally and domestically. I understand that sometimes things go wrong or that you don't get the top of the line service every time, and that's understandable. I've stayed at this hotel a few times and each time I have had issues. I stayed once again hoping that my experience would be better. It started off well with the staff having a room for me early in the day. They were kind and welcoming. But that was the end of it. Here are the issues I encountered this stay as well as past stays:

1. The shower in my room would not drain. The shower would fill up about 2-3 inches and once it drained, it would leave stuff from the drain all over the bathtub. This has been an issue the last two times I've stayed.

2. I ordered the quiche lorraine and had tons of egg shells in it.

3. The shuttle for the hotel pulled up (I was behind it in my car) and it stopped in the middle of the valet area which did not allow me enough space to get around. It stayed there for at least 5 minutes while I sat in my car unable to use the valet. What's the point of valet if I have to sit and wait, especially if I am paying $28/night.

4. My tv frequently would lose video and audio. I would say it was every 5-10 minutes. It would turn off and then on again.

5. When checking out, I wanted to get an updated receipt. I stood in line for at least 15 minutes waiting. As I waited in the starwood preferred line, people were waiting in the regular hotel guest line. The front desk allowed 5 different people to walk up and assisted them as I waited even though I had been next in the starwood line for a significant amount of time. The lady in front of me who was being helped was allowed to stay on her cell phone the entire time slowing the process down significantly. Finally when I got to the front desk, the attendant said nothing to me at all, not even a hello. You figure that if someone was waiting in line for that amount of time, the attendant would at least provide a greeting. I asked for my receipt which took another 3-4 minutes. Now typically I am not an unpatient person, but I was frustrated at this point. The attendant handed me my receipt and said goodbye. One word. Not the service I expect.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.</Review>

<gmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</gmapID><Pictures>None<//Pictures><Response>None</Response>< Name>
A Wang</Name>
<text>DON'T BRING YOUR CAR.  The other reviews are right!  Parking is a joke.  Here's a tip:  Cars don't make sense here.  There is a free shuttle to and from the airport (all terminals) that runs 24/7 every 20min.  Use that to get to and from the airport.  You will pay more to park the car than to rent it!  One reviewer says that they wanted $28 per day but the actual rate is $38 Plus Tax!  I noticed that one guy was paying only $18 but that's still Way too much.  Now, if you need to go somewhere else, you'll need a car and once you have one, you don't have to stay near the airport.  You're free to go somewhere else and that car will pay for itself.  (Hotel is actually much Closer than the rental car agencies so you'll pass it on the way to get your car!)

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was nice and clean but small and had no safe.  Typical high-priced internet that barely works.  Typical $3 bottle of water in room.  Breakfast was included for me but be careful if it's not included for you.  You'll pay $50 for 2 (not including tip) and since it's buffet, a couple might pay $50 for just two cups coffee.  Room rate was mid-priced (not cheap but not over-the-top) but they will get you for parking.  Remember:  If you have to have a car, don't stay here.  If you can get by without one, this place isn't a bad option.  As for the view:  You're a block from one of the busiest airports in the world -what do you expect?  You'll see rental car parking lots, commercial freight companies, and other rooftops.</text>< time>

Most of all it should have been well explained on the website or during the phone call we had upon booking. Otherwise being told at check-in late in the afternoon, at which point we were too exhausted to do anything about it, felt like a gotcha moment which forced us to pay additional fee to park our car.

<rate>None<//rate><review>There was a long line and wait to check-in when I arrived after 10pm. Otherwise, the hotel stay was fine, for a quick overnight before catching an 8am flight.

The shuttle was late, and there were over 15 people in line. The shuttle could not accommodate everyone (I was the last to get on) despite people being willing to stand. The shuttle driver did not inquire about airlines and did not call out terminals. As I saw we were zipping by the terminal I needed, I yelled out "Aren't you going to stop at Terminal 2?" He abruptly stopped and to my surprise, I was not the only one who needed to get off! <userid>103922993812863085714< /userid>< Name>
Darlah V< /Name>
< Time>
1581305576191<//Time>
<rate>5</rate><Text>I have stayed here several times over the past year but never took the time to write a review.  I know how important reviews are to a business so my apologies for the delay.

I stayed there this past weekend.  The staff is good-looking, well-dressed, personable, nice and professional.  The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious.  Starbucks is on the premises - a big plus for me!!!!  The breakfast buffet was great with nice selections.  Our chef (he's going to be mad with me because I forgot his name....bald guy) was very engaging and made our party of 4 some mean omelettes!  The club lounge has a great view and is very relaxing with ample snacks.

It's the best hotel in the area....centrally located with brand name stores nearby to shop.  I  love how the bar area is set up and how it opens up to view outside and you can feel the cool breeze. It gives you a feeling of being outside while inside - great atmosphere.  The pool-side cabana's (not sure if that is what they are called) are such a nice touch and allows for some privacy while being in a public area.  I love everything about this hotel.

The concierge was a pleasant man with so much patience. The waiters in the restaurant were all friendly.  Mark (manager ?) is so down to earth and personable and he made my weekend with the extra touches in my suite for my bridal shower. He went over and beyond. Besos!  The supervisor (Sasha) is a beautiful young woman, inside and outside. She is attentive, warm, and engaging with staff and customers. She was pulled every which way and handled each concern with individualized attention. She's always smiling and such a joy whenever I visit.  I have never stayed anywhere else and don't plan to. Please pass on to management what a great team he/she has as the face of the Sheraton. They are the first ones on the line and leave the first and last impressions for your patrons. I don't know how much is considered when suggestions are made but Mark and Sasha deserve a raise, commendation, certificate, award, etc....or whatever sort of recognition is done, because they represent what the business is all about - pleasing the guests.  They are a big part of why I refer people; keep coming back to your hotel and bringing more people with me. Outstanding job all the way around.  Keep up the good work.< /Text><pictures>None</pictures><resp>{'time': 1532624397984, 'text': 'Darlah, we don‚Äôt mind that it took you more time than you hoped to write such a thoughtful review of your experience with us. Near airport but noise and fumes are a concern.
Stayed on 2 separate bookings. Arrived for breakfast first morning at 9;30 after 11hr flight from UK the night before to be told I had to use Lounge BUT breakfast ended there at 9;30 which shows little recognition of caring for long haul guests with jetlag and need to sleep. No breakfast option before 6;30am so useless for early flights. As SPG Platinum I was expecting either Lounge breakfast or Dinning room but neither were open early for any sort of for breakfast. Lounge is poor and not that friendly.Range of food is very limited and one of the worst I have used. Made tea several nights and milk was either curdled or had run out. < Rating>

<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< review>
I have stayed at this hotel several times - both prior to its renovation and afterwards. I must say they have done a really nice job with the hotel appearance, especially the rooms. They have a very fresh, modern and comfortable feeling to them and provide for a great night sleep.

Sadly the part of this hotel that continuously misses the mark for getting an excellent rating is their front desk. It continues to be woefully understaffed at late hours and early hours. I checked in at approximately 11:00pm and there were only two employees working the check-in desk and eight customers in line. Further aggravating the situation was the two customers being attended to both had reservation problems. We were tired and just wanted our room. At no time did the staff acknowledge the long wait line. 20 minutes later we finally got our room. In the morning (7:15am) it was no better with only one person working the checkout desk. We finally had to leave without getting our receipt as we were going to miss the airport shuttle.

If Sheraton can fix this problem they'll get my excellent rating.< /review>

<text>Somewhat disappointing for a Sheraton stay.

On the positive side, the location is very convenient for catching an early morning flight from LAX and the food from the Italian restaurant is fantastic. The gym is decent enough and the staff at the reception are friendly and efficient.

On the negative side, not all the concierge staff appear to be interested in helping out with questions. More seriously, my room was dark and smelly and the bathroom was not only poorly lit but could also use a good scrub. There were stains on the carpets, throughout, and the decor and furnishings felt like they were from the 60s.

This was my third of three consecutive hotel stays on the same trip. I didn't come with very high expectations. I was just looking for a nice and clean hotel room close to the airport. This one didn't exactly fit the bill.<//text>< Time>

Airline had no room vouchers left, so at 2 AM I was on my own til I could fly out next evening. < Rating>
None<//Rating>
< Review>
We arrived at 1 am at the airport and expected a short shuttle ride to the hotel. After waiting for 20 minutes I called the hotel and was told to wait as the driver would be there shortly. I should note that ALL other hotel shuttles had passed by several times by this point in time. 35 minutes later and no shuttle so I called the hotel again, only to be told that the shuttle would be there shortly; 45 minutes into the wait I tried calling the hotel only to be met repeatedly by a busy signal. I finally got through at 1:55am and was told that they were trying to locate the shuttle driver. I told them that I was waiting no longer and would take a cab at their expense (which I did). The short cab ride (0.5 miles) was $19 ($15 + $2/suitcase). 
At the hotel there were a number of guests at the front desk. While waiting for the manager to express my displeasure re the shuttle service, a guest at the counter chimed in that they had been taken to the wrong Sheraton and that the driver then wanted $5 to take them to the correct hotel (shuttle service is supposed to be free). Another guest beside me was very upset as he had just had all of his luggage stolen. According to the guest he had set his luggage down and either walked away some distance or turned his back and when he looked around the luggage was gone. According to the guest the security cameras showed a car pulling up, a person getting out, loading his luggage into the car and driving off; the guest was still waiting for the police to arrive an hour later.
The next morning we went to the Club Lounge only to be told that it closed in 5 minutes (at 9 am... no one at checkin had bothered to tell us of the early closing time) and that we had better hurry. At 9 am there were over a dozen people in the lounge with a number of guests arriving at the last minute. Despite the large number of guests, food was removed exactly at 9 am. I dont fault the staff as they have their orders but is management not aware of what is going on in the lounge as the guest requirements obviously are not being addressed?</Review>

<Rating>None< /Rating>< Text>
This past month (Feb 2014) we stayed again at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel (LAX) because we had an early morning flight out of Los Angles International (LAX).. We rented a car in Palm Springs (our home town), drove to L.A., check in to the Sheraton Gateway Hotel and return our rented car two blocked from the hotel. The hotel has a free shuttle to LAX that departs every 15 minutes. The Sheraton Gateway Hotel employees are just wonderful, attended to every detail of your stay. We had dinner with friends from L.A. at the hotel restaurant, Paparazzi. It has a wonderful menu that has something for everyone. Our dinner waiter was Kerri Doyle, who attended to every detail of our meal. In summary the Sheraton Gateway Hotel (LAX) is a wonderful choice for an for an easy and delightful way to catch an early flight out of Los Angles LAX airport..< /Text>

<resp>None</resp></record>
</dataset><record>
<text>This hotel works well for those who want to be near LAX. The friendly staff will go the extra mile to help during check-in, and as a Platinum guest, I have always been upgraded, an important aspect for me to stay repeatedly in a Starwood hotel.

Parking is expensive...and slow. But I found an easy cheap alternative: simply park on the street behind the hotel. This is free, and easy, if you only need to be back to the hotel at 10pm, and if you can be gone by 10am.

I did have two complaints. The biggest is that the elevators are very slow. Either some elevators are not turned on, or there are just not enough to meet the need of a busy hotel.

My 2nd complaint may not matter to many, but I am sensitive to noises, and the AC, especially on auto, will shut on and off throughout the night loudly. I think it is just an outdated system.

On the other hand, the AC does effectively keep the room cool as I like, and the black-out drapes successfully keeps the room dark.<//text>< response>
None< /response>

The food experience was as bad as I have experienced anywhere. The shrimp on overpriced shrimp cocktails was soft and soggy and tasted fishy. The chicken, burgers and virtually any meat was way overcooked. Few of the requests made to waiters to adjust or alter food ordered were actually done. "Dressing on the side, no peanut sauce, or whatever" was pretty much ignored. The food selection in the store was pretty weak as well. No fresh fruit or healthy protein bars or shakes.

The tempurature in the main areas of hotel, especially the convention facilities, were below cold and very uncomfortable When asked to warm up the areas no one could figure out how to turn up the temp. Probably held around 60. Froze even with coat on. The rooms were ok but everything except pillows seemed pretty worn out. Not really an experience that justifies payign so much for food and over $160 per night for a room.</Review>

< userid>

<Name>Traveler1992<//Name>< date>
1479340800000<//date>
<rate>None</rate>< Review>
I stay at this hotel regularly (at least 15 times in the past year). The hotel facilities themselves are great : good room size, clean rooms, amenities provided, great club lounge. The location is also wonderful - close to LAX and shuttles provided. The staff here is extremely inconsistent - there are superior staff members such as Brenda, Henry, and Jose that are great at SPG recognition and making your hotel stay wonderful. On the other hand, staff communication here is very inconsistent. I've called in for requests that are never answered, had my stays cut short by the front desk, been billed incorrectly, and am still awaiting make a green choice points to be credited to my account from over a month ago. Overall, this hotel is great for a Sheraton but extremely frustrating customer service with the staff has sometimes made the experience unpleasant. Finally, note that valet service is also very inconsistent - on multiple occasions it has taken over 20 minutes to get my car/car keys have been forgotten so the car was never picked up. On the other hand, most of the valet staff are extremely friendly and provide exceptional service.<//Review>

<userid>None<//userid><user_name>ConditionOne</user_name><Time>1370390400000<//Time><rating>None</rating>< Text>
Checked in late afternoon for a one night stay, and was given a choice of an accessible king room or twin room on the Club Floor. Suites were available per the website, but as it was just one night, I didn‚Äôt push it. I‚Äôve stayed at this property several times over the years, and it‚Äôs a typical airport hotel.

The room is starting to show its age, but it‚Äôs clean. Water pressure was extremely low, and the bathroom is rather cramped. The walls are also a bit on the thin side; you can hear the murmurs of your neighbors while they‚Äôre talking. The desk has a lamp with built in power ports. However, I wasn‚Äôt able to get Internet (either wired or wireless) working.

The Club Lounge is open in the afternoons from 5:30-7pm, and offers cheese, vegetables, soft drinks, and one hot item. Just enough to snack on. Wasn‚Äôt there for breakfast, so I can‚Äôt comment. The room service menu is varied, and the food is actually quite good. The gym is spacious with lots of equipment, which is good, as it‚Äôs usually quite busy.

Not bad for an airport hotel. I‚Äôm not sure if I can stay here for an entire week though. But for one or two nights, it‚Äôs barely adequate.<//Text>

<rate>None< /rate>< Text>
Operating on overload? Just gotta be close to the airport and get basics taken care of? Need quiet and privacy? No need for entertainment at this time? The Sheraton Gateway will serve you well. Bare bones works on a lean budget.

However, if you care to ask, it will be given unto you. Peace and quiet-thank you soooo much! The front desk staff ordered my down pillow. I got my scrambled eggs from the wait staff (a bit watery but I didn't say *hard* or *dry*, did I?). The cleaning ladies giggled a lot and were lovely about leaving my room alone.

Darn, I like fruit and nuts from the trees in the morning(more digestable)- not melon (afternoon) and pineapple (night time). Dark rye is my fav for bread, but nobody carry's it, do they? I would love brown rice instead of potatoes with my eggs: less of a gut plug. And well toasted English muffins are succinct egg sandwich ends for small eaters: not to be found at the breakfast buffet.

One of the cabbies took me through the *shop-a-holic* parts of town on the last day when I was so claustrophobic I could have screamed. (There is nothing to walk to- nothing in the way of small restaurants or shops). He was a breath of fresh air. That glitz life is not my scene so he took me to lunch in another district- a Iranian restaurant. Ahhhhh. Veggies and small amount of meat. Simple, tasty. THX for the relief! Get out of LA LA land, man. It's a choice. If I come back to LA, I want to experience the Ethiopian district for simple fun and food.

Was informed about the Fitness Facility only when I received a preferred guest card. Wish I had had the option to exercise daily in a district where there was nowhere to walk but in circles. Had little time to check out or benefit from this gym. Got no introduction to the Spa either.

Learned a lot about the hotel business. N-Q for your hospitality.<//Text>

<UserId.>100458795585465585262< /UserId.><pictures>None</pictures>< gmapID>
0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /gmapID>
< Rate>
2<//Rate>
< text>
Beware of room 323!
First the positives of the hotel- very close to LAX, prompt airport shuttle and friendly front desk and Starbucks staff.
After a long 5 hour flight from the east coast, I checked in on 3/29/17 and was given room 323. As I got closer to my room, I noticed a lot of commotion. I was surprised to see that right across from my room was a conference meeting room. There was a buffet food station outside and people were gathered around it and talking obviously. I could hear the chatter even with my door closed. It was a good thing that I had to leave for a tour, because if it was peace and quiet that I needed, I wouldn't have found it then.
After returning from my tour that evening, everyone was gone (thankfully). Later as I slipped into bed, I noticed a grittiness in the sheets. I got out and pulled them back to find cracker/cookie crumbs in the sheets. It was 10 pm at this point and that, along with the fact that I had already unpacked my things, prevented me from requesting another room.
I brushed off the sheets and tried to get to sleep. However, at 11:00 pm I was awakened by the sound of a vacuum cleaner outside of my door that lasted about 15 minutes.  I can only imagine they were cleaning the meeting room space and hallway floor. Then as if this wasn't bad enough, I was awakened again at 5:30 am to the sounds of clinging plates and metal warming pans.  As I checked out that morning, it appears they were getting the food station ready for that day's meeting.  I explained these incidents to the front desk clerk who gave me her apologies. She said that a manager would reach out to me (7 days later - not yet). I have never been to a hotel where the meeting rooms and guest rooms were on the same floor, let alone across from one another. My suggestion to the hotel is to turn that room into a storage space or prep room for the conference area (in addition to making sure the linen is crumb-free). To pay $200 for a room and have kind of stay is ridiculous.  The other rooms may be nice, but not room 323. I don't see myself staying there again.</text>

1/ the clear coat on the top of the sink bench has started to come-away around the sink (badly)

<Time>1401753600000<//Time>< Gmap_id>
0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//Gmap_id>
<text>I recently stayed at the Sheraton Gateway LAX Hotel. From the moment I arrived at the property, I felt completely taken care of. The valet waved my sister's car into a parking spot. What appeared to be chaos at first glance, turned out to be a well organized and efficiently run system.

The people at the front desk were very welcoming. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest, and was given a fabulous upgrade. Jonathon Tellez was very professional and courteous. As he checked me in, he gave me several options for my free upgrade. Mustard H Oberoi, the Director of Guest Relations, was very friendly, and offered more hotel services. He made it clear that the Sheraton team (including Rudy) was there to assist me. I am not a VIP, but the team made me feel like one. In addition to complimentary wifi, Jonathon gave us club lounge access. We enjoyed drinks from an espresso machine, and a nice continental breakfast in the morning (delicious fresh fruit, pastries, oatmeal, and/or hard boiled eggs). We were not around for the evening "treats"; however, I am confident they were delicious.

The room was very clean, comfortable, and well appointed. In addition, the bathroom was spotless with no signs of mold. Usually bathrooms and carpets are areas which show a lot of wear and tear, especially at airport locations. This hotel is the exception.

Anca checked me out of our room upon departure. Like the rest of the staff, she was very courteous, efficient, and professional. Within a few minutes, the shuttle bus came, and I arrived at my terminal within minutes.

Airport hotels get a tremendous amount of traffic, and they usually age poorly. One stay may be fine while a subsequent stay might be a mistake. This hotel is the exception. Over the years I've stayed at many Los Angeles properties, but I keep returning to the LAX Sheraton Gateway because of the cleanliness, location, staff, and value.< /text><name>Watravelfun< /name>< userid>
None< /userid>
<pictures>None< /pictures>< rate>
None<//rate>
<response>None</response></record></dataset><record>

My mother and I stayed here for one day due to a layover. She flew in from Korea and wanted to get some rest before getting on a plane again so we decided to stay at the Sheraton because it was near the airport. The facilities are clean and nice - your typical "nice" airport hotel. What made me very uncomfortable was the ignorance of the staff. I was born and raised here and speak English without an accent. On TWO occasions, I asked the concierge and the front desk some questions. I started off my conversation in English and ended the conversation in English. During this time, I translated some of the information to my mom. At the end, both times, the staff says thank you to us in Chinese and something else that I did not understand! If you want to say something, say it in the right language. Either train your staff to understand the differences in languages or just stick to English. No one appreciates it.< /text>

< time>
1348876800000</time>
<name>McGuire</name><pictures>None<//pictures>< resp>
None<//resp>
<rate>None< /rate>< Review>
I love the Gateway at LAX for it's location, comfortable beds, and most of all, it's staff, which is excellent.

Orracio in the Paparazzi is just the best. He remembers his clients, and it's why we keep going back! The food served there is very good, and they even have a cheese plate now, which is a great addition. A good GM named Roman, who also remembers everyone. It does not feel like an LAX hotel, they do such a great job.

Greg out at the bar mixes a good cocktail. He's efficient and one does not have to sit around waiting. A definate plus.

The Club Lounge. Hmmmm, now this lounge was known to be one of the best in the US. What on earth happened? It was also one of the reasons I, and many other colleagues would choose the Gateway over another hotel.

There's barely any food there, and at 6.30pm the other night, it was all gone and they did not bring anymore. Really? But they did up the price of that cheap wine one can buy up there. The lounge is one of the Plat benefits, and this has become a sad lounge. What a shame.

They also have a very nice pool area and a nice roomy gym.<//Review>

<username>BigBill<//username>< Date>
1401753600000< /Date>
< Text>
One of the better airport proximity hotels, I went from my room to my gate in under 15 minutes with a couple of strokes of timing luck, but that was exceptional even with good fortune. Bus driver was great, so was the efficiency of the front desk agent. Not much Platinum recognition, room was ordinary with a very dated bath with poor water pressure and Sheraton Club was very sparse - at 11 p.m. bottled water and a TV were the amenities. Lobby facilities are far too little to handle the number of guests and rooms. Breakfast was perfunctory in the Club Lounge. Location makes this hotel, it can use a number of updates, the lounge was almost comical but overall the hotel was a good price value to be completely fair. It was quiet as well.< /Text>

<time>1405641600000</time><rating>None</rating>< Text>
I arrived at 11pm, after a long day of meetings on the East Coast, and the West Coast. I hardly noticed all the room service trays in the hallway as I walked to my room, as my goal was just to get to the room and rest. Arriving in the room to find an insect in the restroom is not what one expects, and may be explained by the overall uncleanliness of the hallways. I returned downstairs to change rooms. I was promptly given a new room, but without being told that the King Bed would now be two single beds. Being tired, I decided not to waste my time going downstairs again. The final point was when I asked why at checkout there was no complimentary water in the room, I was told that the $3 water was complimentary for Platinum Guests. This was fine, and I decided it was just a bad stay, and I would not take this any further, things happen. The only reason I am posting this review is I received a bill this morning for $3 for the "complementary water". I called, and was told to speak with accounting, which just seems ridiculous. I would stay as far away from this hotel as possible. Having spent over 500 nights in starwood group hotels, this one is by far the worst.<//Text>

<time>1540436933996</time>< Rating>
4</Rating>
<review>A lovely, contemporary, union hotel. The spaces are elegant and well maintained.

Located a few hundred feet from the entrance of LAX (Los Angeles International Airport), the eight hundred room hotel provides a free airport pick up service,, 24 hours a day.

The elevators are fast. The facilities, including a pool and exercise room, are well maintained.  There are several restaurents and a bar on the first floor. All are beautifully decorated, with servers, who are knowledgeable and friendly. The meals are well prepared and presented.  Whenever possible, the chef will prepare dishes to your dietary requirements.

We stayed in the Executive Suite. The two rooms have lots of comfortable furniture, a safe, coffee machine, super comfortable king-size bed and a couple of sixty inch televisions.

The modern glass and black steel bathroom, has a large walk-in shower and good lighting. My only complaint: the toilet paper roll is difficult to reach.

This upscale suite includes access to "The Club" on the 15th floor. In the middle of the day the club offers a selection of snacks, an assortment of coffee drinks, teas and soft drinks. In the morning breakfast is served. There is no charge for this comfort.

Alcoholic drinks are available in the bar on the first floor.

The hotel is ADA compliant. Parking is expensive.<//review>< pictures>
None</pictures>
