<Rating>None<//Rating>< Review>
Had a horrible experience with the hotel valet when they parked another car in front of ours on purpose. When we confronted them, they said they did it because we stayed parked there too long. LIttle did they know we had a 2 year old with the stomach flu that we were trying to rush up to our room and get settled. The front desk person didn't even look me in the eye or care about our situation at all.
Room service staff was delightful, but the food was cold, dry and average. The first morning we had a beautiful fruit plate delivered and the next morning we ordered the same thing and got a bowl of chunked fruit. Manager of the hotel didn't seem to care and offered us a "free movie" to make up for all of our troubles.</Review>

<time>1437415433700</time><Rating>1< /Rating><review>This hotel was the worst experience i have ever had with a hotel. When we checked in the hotel was already paid in full on my credit card. At time of check in i was told everything was set they just needed a debit card to hold a $75 deposit so they did it then the next morning i call my card balance to find out that Sheraton gateway had pulled $217.40 from my account. <UserId.>102958050113741239353<//UserId.><username>Jerry Del Colliano</username><Date>1393634968667< /Date><rate>1<//rate>< review>
I came to the Sheraton Gateway LAX to plan a large event as they have significant exposition space and relatively low room rates. This property was recommended to me by my travel agency as it has been updated recently by the guy who did the SLS Hotel on La Cienega in West Hollywood.

I confirmed that my dates were open and met with the entry level salesperson as the hotel had what I needed for my group which would have taken over most of their conference space and upwards of 300 rooms over a few days. This was a Monday and I was promised a bid by the next day - Tuesday. By Wends - I had to call to check on the bid with no answer. I heard nothing again until Friday when I was assured a bid was coming. It never came.

I called the property's General Manager, Michael Washington, and then heard from the Director of Sales who brought in the A-Team for a meeting. She confirmed dates, consulted with the security people on issues about the show, talked about how to show cars (part of my show) and showed me the inventory at the show. She sent me a bid complete with spelling errors and missing details. It was very much of "what we can't do for you". I asked to go over this with her on a phone meeting 1.5 weeks in and an 11:30 Wednesday meeting was set. I called the number at 11:30 and no answer. I sent an email. I heard nothing from the Director of Sales until I called her again at 3:30 that day. She starts in with the what we can't do for you and her favorite line "Let me be honest with you" which she stated easily 10x in the call. If she's being honest with me at that point does this mean she's lying the other times? Stay tuned... the story only gets better.

Remember the GM? He never returned my 2 phone calls. Friday at 4:30 I hear from him with the Director of Sales on the phone to say "we are renovating our space and can't accommodate your event". Really? You made that decision in the two weeks since I reached out to you? No you didn't. You just wasted 2 weeks of time working with your hotel.

If you are planning to host an event and want professional service - RUN don't walk from the Sheraton Gateway LAX. My father always used to say in companies "the fish stinks from the head down" and you can see what you get from the Sheraton Gateway LAX. Lies, misinformation, bait-and-switch pricing (the first salesman offered me a group rate $20 less than what the director of sales offered" and more.

Buyer beware.<//review>

< text>
When I arrived on July 13, after unpacking I sat to relax for a few moments to watch TV but found it not working. After crawling around to seeing if I could find connection problems (unsuccessfully), I decided to call the desk or housekeeping to report the problem. The phone was also not working! By them I had to depart for an appointment and reported the problems to the front desk. By the time I returned late that evening, the problems had been solved. The next morning, I went down to the hotel exercise facility (it is great!) and after the workout I found that my room key would not permit access to the 15th floor (my room was 1566). I went to the desk and was told that the magnetic striip was the likely problem and a new key was made. HOWEVER, since I did not take ID with me to the gym, I had to wait for security reasons to be escorted to my room. The desk clerk called for assistance and I/we waited a full ten minutes or more before someone finally responded. Once we got to the room, he just opened the door and let me in without any check of credentials so I don't see the point of a security escort. The upshot was that I was late for my first appointment that morning. This was unusual because I've always been very satisified with my Starwood experiences, but this was definitely a disappointment.<//text>

He saidhe was sorry and promised breakfast delivered to our room the next morning as a courtesy. Next morning no breakfast. so we went about our business. Next day morning, i called front desk and explained that we were promised a complementary breakfast. She forwarded call to manager. I left a message but no one called after 1 hr. so i called again and finally got manager. He said he will see what he can do. A few minutes later a bell boy showed up with 4 breakfast vouchers. So eventhough breakfast was not delivered to our room, we enjoyed a fantastic breakfast buffet using the vouchers. No complaints about the second room. A bit less spacious. <user_name>AmandaS</user_name>< time>
1389744000000< /time>
<rate>None<//rate>< text>
I decided to stay at the Gateway Sheraton because a conference I was attending was here at a special discounted price. I will NEVER stay at one again.

The customer service was terrible. I don't mean bad and needs work, but terrible. I have never been treated like this before.

As I walked in, I was greeted by a man to check in. At first he was nice but was coughing ALL over the desk and not covering his mouth.. gross. Then I went to pay on debit since I wasnt traveling with my credit card and read in my email that I could do debit. He had no idea how to process this so he told me I could charge a credit card from someone who wasnt staying here as long as I got there email. I decided to give them my boyfriends email and started spelling it out for him. He immediately got VERY rude and said ‚ÄúI ASKED for you to WRITE it down!‚Äù so I asked for a pen and he just threw it on the counter. Not impressed and completely taken off guard. I then called my boyfriend to transfer him my room cost so he could pay it on his card. The front desk emailed him the proper forms and told me to go sit and wait because he had to deal with ‚Äúreal customers.‚Äù I felt very talked down to because I wasn't wearing a suit like the men behind me and he said I wasnt a ‚Äúreal customer‚Äù .. What does that even mean? Because I hadnt paid yet? My boyfriend then didnt understand some of the information being asked so I asked if someone could call him and explain it. The man then went to tell his supervisor to ask her to call. 20 minutes later she finally called and walked him through the form. My boyfriend told me it was all good to go. I sat there on the couches for another 30 minutes waiting for someone to grab me to check me in (meanwhile no other customers were at the counter) and finally I went up and asked if the form was complete. The manager rudely told the man that she had printed it off (like he was supposed to just know). The man proceeded to get the sheet and put the information into the computer. He then charged me an extra night which I caught right away and he didnt actually believe I paid when I booked online. Then checked and realized I did and mumbled some stuff under his breath. He then asked how I was paying for the $75 incidentals and I said with the credit card. (since I only had debit) and he said that couldnt be done. I then spoke up and said ‚ÄúYou KNEW I only had debit! Theres nothing I can do about this because you didnt charge the card!‚Äù (which I admit shouldnt have done but I was getting very frustrated after all of this. He then told me there was an ATM which he decided not to let me know before I went through all the credit card hassle. I went and took out $80 for him. I then asked to speak to his manager (not knowing it was that rude lady from before). She came up to me and I expressed my disappointment in their quality of service and she quickly defended herself by saying ‚ÄúWell I have other things to take care of too.‚Äù Which I totally understand but you would rather help a guest who JUST walked up to the counter before you help the one who has been waiting over an hour to get checked in. Just terrible. She apologized insincerely so I just left it and went to my room. I then got into my room and realized I had no wifi so I called down and asked if it was complimentary. Apparently I have to pay $12 a day to get wifi where in my email says ‚ÄúSweet Sleeper Bed, 32 Inch Flat Panel LCD TV, Wi-Fi Internet..‚Äù So I asked why it said that in there and she said ‚ÄúJust so youre aware of the service we provide. It is extra money though‚Äù So my question is, do you charge extra for your beds? Or Tvs? Why put it in there and charge extra. Just completely taken back. I then went and sat downstairs in the Lobby for 2 hours to work on the wifi and decided to just go up and pay the $12. So I asked to pay for wifi and the guy at the desk informed me that it was complementary and he just had to refresh it but it should be working now. Such an inconvenience after I even called. Poor poor service. Everything was just going wrong and VERY unimpressed. I have 40 of my clients coming down for this event and I will make sure to tell them all my experience and I know I will not recommend this hotel or stay here ever again. Even if it were free. Customer service is number one and this hotel has none of it, as far as I can tell.<//text>

<Text>I recently visited the Sheraton Gateway LAX for a whirlwind 18 hour trip to LA. Upon arriving to the property, I was promptly greeted by a very cordial valet. In fact, every time I pulled up, the valets were so friendly and an ideal first impression of the hotel. The front desk was slow. Both agents I encountered were very friendly, but didn't move with any sort of urgency, instead demonstrating uncertainty. When I took a shower in the morning, the tub was very slow draining and in my brief shower, about an inch and a half of standing water accumulated. I mentioned this to the front desk when checking out, so another guest did not have the same experience and was apologized to and offered a meager apology with some SPG points. All in all, the staff was friendly and wanted to make sure I had a good time, but recovery and urgency was lacking at the front desk.< /Text><pictures>None< /pictures><resp>None</resp>< GmapID>

<time>1369008000000<//time><Review>The carpeting in the hallway, at least on the 3rd floor, looked pretty old. The hallway carpet, at least on the 3rd floor, looked like it needs to be cleaned; dingy and dirty. In my opinion, the breakfast buffet was over priced.

After I checked in, I decided I would go to the lobby lounge/bar to have a meal and drink a beer or two. The lounge did not appear as though it was busy; lots of staff and approximately 10-15 customers. However, it took approximately 15 minutes before the waiter approached the table I was seated. After ordering, 1 beer and a meal. The waiter promptly returned with my beer and a small container of snacks and he left. It took me approximately 20 minutes to consume the contents of the small snack container and half of the beer I ordered. Since placing my initial order with my waiter, he was nowhere to be seen. The number of customers present at the lounge increased to approximately 20-25 people. Since I had not yet received the meal I ordered, had an empty snack container and half a beer, I decided I would like another container of snacks to consume with the beer. Since my waiter was nowhere to be seen and since my table was in close proximity to the bar (approximately 7 feet,) I made eye contact with a bartender, held up my empty snack container, requested more snacks, and began to watch a televised sport event. After approximately 7 minutes, I noticed, not one had responded to my table to provide me with another snack container. I made eye contact with the same bartender that I previously requested more snacks from and requested an update on the snack refill I initially requested. The bartender then pointed to a small snack container on the bar near another customer, abruptly returned to his duties of tending bar, and made no further eye contact with me. From his nonverbal cues, I surmised he expected me to leave the table I was seated at to retrieve the snack container I requested.

My waiter whom I initially placed my order with returned to my table with the meal I ordered; approximately 10 minutes after I retrieved the second snack container from the bar. Approximately 55 minutes lapsed between the time I entered the lounge, ordered and received my meal. After my waiter presented my meal, he disappeared again. I finished eating my meal within approximately 15 minutes. During this time, my waiter never returned to my table. The only other time he did return, was at the time, I noted he was walking up to the bar. I then flagged him down, and upon his arrival at my table I requested the check, which he provided within 7 minutes, approximately. Upon paying my bill, I concluded I would never return to that lounge again. The lack of customer service I experienced was unacceptable; that's an understatement.< /Review>< user>

<Text>Good hotel for location and price. Internet is free with spg status and parking is some of the cheapest you'll find for a hotel in the area.< /Text><Pics>None</Pics><Response>None< /Response><GmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d</GmapID></record></dataset><record>
< userid>
104645770409474144111<//userid>
<user_name>reese marlin< /user_name>< time>
1481502501944< /time>
< rate>
1<//rate>
< text>
The most ever worst experiences with Sheraton! We booked it from Expedia. They give us the top floor facing the airport. It is very noisy inside the room. You can hear the huge noise made by the landing planes every a few minutes. Yes, LAX is a quite busy airport. It feels like you are beside a giant motor engine. The water runs really slowly in the shower that I can hardly wash my hair.
The reception is neither nice nor patient. I asked them if we could change the room for the following couple of days, they were very reluctant to answer me and the answer was to check later. No breakfast, no free wifi. $12 per day for wifi.
No free parking. There is a very expensive public parking behind Sheraton and you can get one day ticket from the hotel, charging you $17. It is quite annoying that we don't know it when we first checked in and later came to know it from the managing people in parking lot. The 1st day ticket got invalid within 24 hours and the reception was very rude when I consulted them about it.
The room is very small, less of equipment, even without electronic boiler to get hot water! The TV channels are also quite limited with very few. I can't imagine this is a famous hotel.
I would not recommend Sheraton for travelers.
I personally will never choose Sheraton.</text>

<Name>Owen11</Name><time>1404345600000</time><Rating>None< /Rating><review>I have stayed at the Sheraton Gateway on many of my trips to LAX, I stayed on two occasions this June..As usual your service standards, from front desk check in to checkout were of the highest order, I felt that most facets of my experience at The Gateway hotel were very good, but I feel I must point out to you and management of an area that is starting to deteriorate, and that is the club longe experience..on both occasions during my stays in June there seemed to be little or no attention being paid by your staff to dress standards, or codes of dress adopted by some of the guests.. In particular the appropriate shoe code that management has seen fit to post a sign at the entrance to the lounge..It is quite clearly displayed, and quite rightly so. However, it is being blantantly ignored by a number of your guests( fortunately in a minority) I find bare feet in a lounge such as yours during cocktail hours, or while eating food is there quite disgusting.. Unfortunately I must point out that one of your staff members that works in this lounge obviously does not care either.The person I refer to (a female) worked on both the Sunday evening shift and the Monday evening shift (5.30 to 7.30 p.m) on the 29th & 30th of June 2014. At all times she was there she paid no attention what so ever to people walking around without the appropriate footware!! She can not say she did not notice them, as on a couple of occasions she spoke to these people when they asked her questions..To be very frank I was extremely disappointed to see dress standards that I saw whilst I was a guest in your lounge, and even more so to see that your employee in this instance did not care either, but a line must be drawn TANK TOPS, & NO FOOTWARE is not appropriote to a hotel with such high standards as the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles..
Thank you for your time..< /review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< resp>

Susan Powers< /username>
<Date>1501439843784< /Date>< Rate>
5<//Rate>
< Text>
We (my daughter and I) tagged along with my husband as he was here for work. We had an amazing experience. Our first experience as we pulled up was only valet parking. I really didnt want to pay the extra money but the valet attendant was so personable, and helpful, it just made me feel like I didnt have to worry about dragging luggage from a park and fly across the street by myself and trying to keep track of my 5 yo. The Bell Hop, Giovanni, AMAZING! From the time we took our luggage out of the car I didnt have to handle it. He took our luggage and said to go check in. It was nice not to deal with it and my child while checking in at the same time. So kind, patiently waited for us. Best well- mannered bell hop I have ever experienced. All of the house keeping ladies on our floor (15) were amazing and helpful. The Club Lounge attendants were all amazing as well! Thank you for keeping ourbellies s full with yummy food and treats! Soda and espresso bar too. Overall, I give this hotel 5 stars Thank you evwryone</Text>

< Rating>
1<//Rating>
< review>
First off the website is very misleading, it said free parking, so we booked the room then my husband called to verify our reservation which is when we were hit with the $30 a night parking fee. Very upsetting and all that was offered is $50 towards a future stay, good thing we can use it at a different property. Parking is only $17 if you pay at the gate directly, and the lot is a block away. Check in was a lengthy process. The clerk checking us in had to make a phone call like she couldn't find our reservation, she also didn't speak up or clearly so we could understand her. The room was decent but they charge $26 a person for breakfast. We did not pay that for blah hotel breakfast. Luckily Starbucks is in the lobby. Walls are super thin, sounded like someone was being murdered next door, a lot of banging on the walls and loud thumps on the floor.
Other than that it was ok. At checkout, two clerks were carrying a conversation, did not address us even though both looked at us. My husband had to say I need to checkout. The woman talked fast and over him as if to get us out of the way. We hadn't even walked away before she went back to her conversation. very rude and unprofessional. Will never stay here again. Would have been better off at the holiday inn down the street. We expected more from a Starwood property.<//review>

<text>It was such a great stay at this hotel. I wasn't expected very much cuz i though it's just an another airport hotel but I was very surprised. We booked at the Sheraton Downtown Hotel at first for our LA trip but we changed to this hotel cuz we were going to have the rental car and the car parking itself is $40+ a day at the downtown Sheraton. So, we decided to stay at the Sheraton Gayeway which is still 4stars hotel with the good reviews plus the cheaper parking and great complimentary buffet breakfast. It's totally the winner if you are going to have  the rental car. You can go anywhere in LA within 30-45min Max 1hour but it's worth it you can throw everything you need into your car and you don't have to deal with waiting the public transportation. Free wifi, free breakfast, nice big pool, and a hot tub, everything there make us so pleased and everyone there were very nice, friendly and responded very quickly as well. Don't be hesitate and think too much. This is LA and it's way better than your expectations for the price. Trust me I'm a kind of very detail person always looking for the best one with a great deal and this is the one.<//text><GmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d< /GmapID><response>None</response><Rating>5</Rating></record></dataset><record>

<text>Upon check-in I approached the gentleman behind the desk (around noon on 6/16/2013). He told me (Gold member) and my co-worker (Platinum member) that it was too early to check-in but he would be right with us. When he was finished with the guest he was with, I explained that we requested an early check-in. We were both just discussing how customer oriented the staff is at this Westin but we were both a little turned off by his comment. Nevertheless, he checked us in.

When I arrived at my room (575) I pulled back the bedspread and the sheets were all wrinkled (fitted and top). The sheets are pressed at this hotel and should not be wrinkled. This indicates to me that the sheets weren't changed and the bed was made with the old sheets from a previous guest and made to look like the sheets were changed. I asked Housekeeping for a new set of sheets. The housekeeper in charge of my room kept telling me that the room was just checked by the supervisor. I suppose that the supervisor does not check the cleanliness of the sheets or that he/she has the same sub-par standards as the housekeeping staff changing (or not changing) the sheets.

I travel all over the world on a regular basis and have only experienced this type of short-cut done at hotels here in the United States. I have never had this type of experience in European or Asian hotels. It happens about 30% of my domestic hotel stays. It's a direct display of laziness by the employees and supervisory staff and should not be an acceptable practice at any hotel especially an SPG hotel.</text></record>

<Rating>None</Rating>< review>
I am very disappointed with this facility. My boyfriend and I arrived at about 1:30am and the receptionist could not even locate our reservation. The we were delayed because their Key machine was out of order, then once that came back up we go up to our room and our key doesn't work so we are forced to go back downstairs to then come back up and get the smelliest room I have ever stayed in so we contact the front desk for assistance and are told that they are sold out and we would have to wait for the next day. Suddenly, we get a call to the room that we are indeed being changed rooms...so much for "sold out".
The next day we didn't even get our room cleaned and later realized that they were charging us extra for reasons they couldn't even explain AND they were charging us for two vehicles in the valet parking when we only had one! This made our trip very unpleasant and undesirable :-( Absolutely terrible.</review>

<Date>1375740092160<//Date><gmap_id>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//gmap_id><review>My family and I normally stay at a Marriott or Hyatt; I have only stayed in two Sheraton hotels and have to say I am not impressed! Exhausted, tired kids, and checking in at 10:30 pm. My first impression of the Sheraton Gateway LAX has a distinct smell of bad musk cologne. I kept turning around trying to find the guy that would dive into the much cologne until I realized it was the hotel! When I walked up to the Front Desk the agent did not even look up and greet me. She just stared at the computer screen and asked for my driver's license and credit card - I felt like I was at the DMV. I just stood there waiting for her to look up (which took a few seconds) and then asked her if she even knew what I looked like.  I expressed my disappointment with the last Sheraton I stayed at the night before and was hoping this one would be better. She did express her regret that our last stay at a Sheraton was not a good experience, apologized for the lack of a greeting and offered me four free breakfast buffet vouchers.  I thought that was nice of her.  She asked if I was parking a car and I said yes I was packing a rental car.  She stated there were three options; the first one was a onetime self-parking of eleven dollars, the second option was an in and out self-parking for seventeen dollars, and the third was valet parking for thirty-three dollars.  Thirty-three dollars a night for valet parking... really?  Well, I took the seventeen dollar option and was given a card to use. What I was not told by her was it was not an access card into the airports long-term parking (it appears they do not have a parking lot themselves) so my card was eaten by the machine and I had to wait twenty minutes for an parking attendant to arrive to fix it.

When I finally arrived to room it appeared clean except for the carpet which was dirty and stained. It was not until I climbed into bed and found three type of hairs in-between the pillows that I had an issue with the room - one being a pubic hair. I called down to the front desk to see If I could get the bedding changed and was transfer to another person that agreed to send someone up to the room to take care of the issue. I waited for thirty minutes with my sleepy son until I hear a knock on the door. In walks a guy with two pillows, lays the pillows on the bed and say "okay?!"  I asked if he would change the bedding and he responded with another "okay?!" and turn to leave. I asked him again to take care of the situation and he finally realized what I was asking him to do. His response was to brush the hairs off the bed and onto the floor. At that point he says "okay?!" I told him fine I will deal with other peoples hair and said "okay".

The shower was old and the showerhead was calcified.

The downstairs concierge seemed to never be at the desk when needed.

On the plus side:

Internet was free
There was no "resort fee"

You get one small free bottle of water - three bucks if you want the big bottle! - LOL

The breakfast buffet was good for being free - I would not spend twenty-four for it!

The staff was nice but disorganized and seemed to be just waking up, even though it was about 9:30 am.

The bellhop was friendly and helpful

The shuttle two and from LAX is great and runs every ten minutes.< /review><Rate>1<//Rate><pics>None< /pics><Name>John Stewart</Name><resp>None< /resp><UserId.>106240114588113991738< /UserId.></record></dataset><record>

< rating>

< Review>
We had our worst experience with this hotel and it was an absolute nightmare. We originally stayed for 5 nights and then wanted to book an additional night the following week (since we were leaving for a cruise). We simply asked the front desk to book the additional night with the exact same add-ons we had before when we last booked (eg breakfast, wifi, number of beds etc). They gave us a confirmation and we thought we would be on our merry way. However when we came back from our cruise we were told that we did not ask for breakfast and that we would have to pay extra for it which made no sense since the lady we spoke to for the second booking assured us that the exact same add-ons had been included.

Also when we asked to speak to the same lady we spoke to before in order to sort this out, we were told she was not here....but we later literally spotted her working a couple meters away. When asked why this was we were told she was on her lunch break, but it was around 6-7PM when this happened...

Worst of all, when their front desk supervisor, Gregory Yanez, came out to speak to us he was extremely abrupt, rude and did not show any sympathy. He acted like we were the ones that did something wrong and after giving us our "options" he simply walked away without a second word. When we called him back he explained that he was being "direct." This makes no sense as this is a hotel and we were on vacation, not at a drill camp, there was no need for him to be excessively direct. There was absolutely no customer service involved and we felt like we were being blamed for their mistake. We will no longer stay at this hotel when we visit LA anymore.< /Review>

<name>Yvr1< /name><GmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//GmapID>< text>
I have stayed at this hotel several times and always had a good stay. I recently stated here from August 16th - 19th. I had problems from the moment I arrived. When I arrived there was a party going on in the hotel which had been going on non-stop from Friday. There was no where for me to valet my car. I had to drive around the corner at 12:30am to park in a car park. You would think the hotel would keep some parking spots on a Sunday night for business travellers. I had the bellman take my bags up while I parked my car. During that time the door must have closed behind the bellman latching the security bar. When I came up to the room I was unable to enter. It took three phone calls to the front desk and 20 minutes later for me to get it. If this was not enough I asked for a wake up call to catch my early morning flight on my last day and I did not receive it. How can an airport hotel not deliver a wake up call? I filled in an online survey for the hotel, however I am still waiting for a reply!<//text>

<response>None< /response><review>I had a corner suite, handicapped accessible. I asked for a refrigerator to house my medications.  When I arrived no refrigerator. called housekeeping, told would cost me 50usd, advised I neededitfor medication, told same price.I said no problem, I would pay. Still no refrigerator.  Discovered room has a few mistakes in it.  I couldnt find the drawer space near bed. Had to go clear accross room for a waste basket.  I asked for roll in shower, but it has a wierd lip trick to keep water in, this would be hard to roll accros or step accross for people who have had a stroke with any leg paralysis.  Its purpose was to hold water in but the shower curtain is at the same parallel location so a tremendous amount of water covered the whole floor.  The light switch is placed to the back ofthe sink.  It is hard to reach, please move it to the outside of the bathroom or on back of closet wall in bathroom.  Also no warming light.  The room is large and you get cold trying to dry off.  There are no switches for the lighting from the bed.  the closet rods are too high, there is no in room safe.  I think that you should rethink just how small the sink is no room for toiletries.  the amenity package of toiletries was horrible, I say again horrible.  You are a Sheraton, a premier hotelier and your amenities come from a 7/11.  I travel every week and I have had better amenities from Motel 8.  The front desk was great and the maids were great.  Had to ask for more towels everyday.  Also It would be great to teach the maid staff that washcloths should be placed in the tub/shower area. At first glance I was only mildly underwhelmed with my room. I referred to it as "cottage/executive" and thought it was a quaint little space. <user_id>113430922239707124853<//user_id>< name>

<date>1492734885986<//date><Rate>3< /Rate><text>There was someone already checked in my assigned room. The staff quickly corrected it.< /text>< Pics>

< Rate>
None<//Rate>
<Resp>None</Resp><gmapID>0x80c2b6d4e2d10a59:0x8fc3dc08704b5f1d<//gmapID><user_name>BrianGoldSPG</user_name><Pics>None<//Pics>< UserId.>
None< /UserId.>
<review>I've stayed at several Sheraton hotels recently and I must admit that they been sub-par or average at best. I noticed online that the Gateway had been recently remodeled and had mostly good reviews so I decided to give Sheraton one more try. I'm so glad I did! This was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. EVERYONE I encountered was friendly and accommodating, the bed was super comfortable and I loved the gym, pool and hot tub. Hats off to the entire management team and staff members for a well deserved 5-star review. I spent 4 nights there and didn't want to leave.

In this review I'm going to address some of the things others brought up here on TA so hopefully you can make an informed decision.

There is a free airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes making it fast and easy to get to/from the hotel. If you have a car, the hotel promotes valet parking. For self parking, drive into the hotel entrance and head straight back past 98th street and you'll dead end to a privately-owned airport parking lot. They allow Sheraton guests to park there for about $14 a night. You will need to pre-pay and then will get in and out privileges during your entire stay. Warning, the lot fills up on weekends (I arrived on Wednesday so had no problem). I noticed they were turning folks away on Friday/Saturday. There is 2-hour street parking on 98th but you'll get a ticket if exceed the two hour limit so be warned. Valet is expensive -- I think around $24 a night -- about $10 more than self-parking. There may be other parking options nearby but you would need to check with hotel staff.

I arrived at 1:30 pm and being an SPG Gold Member was hoping I could get an early check-in and a complimentary room upgrade. In my recent stays at Starwood properties Gold members don't get decent upgrades so I was pleased that the Gateway recognized my status and upgraded me to the Club Floor (Top Floor, 15th - with Key Access only). I was able to check into my room early but immediately noticed that the air conditioning was making a funny dripping noise (which was pretty annoying). I called the front desk and they sent an engineer up. At first he said I would need to change rooms but he was able to fix the problem after all. I received a follow-up call to see if I wanted to change rooms and I declined. Great service, no problem.

The club lounge was really nice, very large and had a great view of the LAX runway. The lounge has a good selection of fruit, cereal, bagels and juice for breakfast as well as complimentary snacks for dinner. Beer and wine can be purchased from 4-8 pm for a nominal fee. During the day you have access to the lounge where you can work, watch TV, read the paper or get an espresso. A computer/printer is also available for use at no charge. I was able to print my boarding pass there.

The lobby/entrance of the hotel is really nice and features free WI-Fi. Lots of people were hanging out in the lobby with friends, work colleagues or on their computer sipping a glass of wine. Very fun vibe. It has a W feel to it without the annoying drunk/party crowd.

For me, the highlight of the hotel was the gym and pool/hot tub. The gym is big and has a great selection of modern equipment. As for the pool, it was like I had it all to myself. It's also open really late which is a big plus! The pool area has comfy lounge chairs, large daybeds, FREE heated cabanas (great for socializing at night) -- the space is very relaxing and well thought out. My only complaint for the pool area is that smokers hang out there and blow smoke all over you. I wish they didn't allow smoking in the pool area.

The rooms are nice, updated and have great beds. Housekeeping was really friendly and did a great job servicing my room. I only wish there was a safe, fridge and iPod connector in the room. The bathroom was small and a bit dated but functional. I too experienced problems with drainage in the bathtub (as others here have mentioned). The walls are pretty thin and the first night I got awoken at 4 am by some really loud folks in the room next to me. It was really annoying but they must have checked out as the next 3 nights were really quiet. I love that fact that the room was totally dark with the curtains closed. Pitch black... great for sleeping.

We had an amazing dinner Saturday night at the hotel's restaurant called Paparazzi. It's unique Italian food with a twist. With the tip and a bottle of wine, it came to $190 for 3 of us so it was pretty pricy but the atmosphere and food quality was great. Our server was also very efficient and friendly. He explained several dishes to us and how they were prepared. Be sure and get the artichokes as an appetizer. Amazing presentation!

I wish all Sheraton hotels were like the Gateway. I will now look for Sheraton hotels that have been recently remodeled. Many of the older Sheraton hotels are in pretty bad shape. They did a fantastic job with the remodel on the Gateway and I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. The service and friendliness of the staff really stood out for me.

Congrats on a fantastic job Gateway... I'll be back!<//review>< Time>
1320710400000<//Time>
</record></dataset><record>

We first got into a room and started unpacking, and I saw a spider on the curtain! I'm terrified of bugs but decided to kill it instead of actually calling someone up, it was already late at night at this time. The walls must be very thin- because during the whole stay I could hear music playing from the next room which was really distracting. My cousin who stayed in the bed closer to the door commented that she had trouble sleeping because she could hear the slamming of other doors in the next rooms. < text>
We waited for a while to finally see someone from inside to come out to help. ( somehow staff saw people were waiting but no one came out to help until one of customers requested!)
And it was disappointed that when there is a line created specific for spg preferred guest so we waited there considering we are the member but yet we were waiting along with the regular line and were asked to go regular counter when our turn was up.

Then it took them a while to locate an available room based on what we booked.

There were an human error on room assignment. And then we finally were directed to the right room and realized they were still rushing the cleaning process.

And then next morning, the hotel employee accessed to our room without knocking. He shut the door when he realized we still in the room but I went after him because I tried to figured out if it were another double booking instance but then happen to learn he is the mechanic related position in the hotel.

Mattress was worn too so it was not comfortable.
We booked this hotel due to location. We stayed here the first night of our vacation and will stay here again the last night of our vacation. However, after the first time experience, we are not excited the fact we have to return this hotel.

Every once a while, some of these instance happens. We were just out of luck to experience them all together in one stay when we were exhausted from the travel.<//text>
